Developer Experience & SDKs.description: A comprehensive set of client-side SDKs for popular frameworks (React, Next.js, etc.), a core JavaScript library, and a command-line interface (CLI) to accelerate integration and setup.

files.description: This file is the changelog for the `@novu/nextjs` package, detailing version updates, new features, bug fixes, and contributors across different releases.

This README provides documentation for the Novu Next.js SDK, detailing how to integrate and configure the Inbox component in a Next.js application, including installation, usage, localization, and security features like HMAC encryption.

This directory is intended to store theme-related assets, styles, or configurations specifically for the Next.js application within the Novu project. Its purpose is to centralize visual styling definitions, enabling consistent theming across the Next.js frontend.

This directory is designated to house custom React hooks specifically designed for use within the Next.js package. Its purpose is to centralize reusable logic and state management functionalities for Next.js components, even though it is currently empty.
This file re-exports themes from the `@novu/react` package, making them available for client-side use within the Next.js application.

This file serves as the server-side entry point for the Novu Next.js package, re-exporting various types, components, hooks, and enums from '@novu/react' and '@novu/react/server' for server-side usage.
This file serves as a client-side entry point for Next.js, re-exporting all React hooks from the `@novu/react` package.
This file serves as the changelog for the @novu/react-native package, detailing version updates, new features, bug fixes, and dependency changes over time.

This README file provides an introduction to Novu's React Native SDK, `@novu/react-native`, detailing its use for building custom inbox notification experiences in mobile applications. It includes installation instructions and code examples for getting started.
This file configures `tsup` to build the TypeScript source code for a React Native package, specifically targeting client-side code and generating both ESM and CJS formats with type declarations.

This file serves as the main entry point for the Novu React Native package, re-exporting all hooks from the core `@novu/react` package. It enables React Native applications to utilize the Novu React hooks.

This file defines a collection of reusable React components for displaying skeleton loading states, including placeholders for text, avatars, and switches. These components utilize gradient backgrounds to simulate a loading animation.
This file defines the `TooltipContent` component, which renders the visual content of a tooltip, handling its positioning, animation, styling, and portal-based rendering.
This file exports a composite `Tooltip` component, bundling `TooltipRoot`, `TooltipTrigger`, and `TooltipContent` along with their styling variants.

This file defines the `DropdownRoot` component, which acts as the base wrapper for a dropdown menu. It configures the underlying `Popover.Root` component with default placement settings for dropdown functionality.

This file defines the `PopoverContent` component, which renders the content area of a popover, handling its styling, positioning, and interaction logic such as closing on outside clicks or escape key presses. It utilizes a `Portal` for rendering and integrates with a `PopoverRoot` context.
This file serves as an aggregate export for various custom React hooks used for interacting with the API, centralizing their access within the UI layer.
This file serves as an index for UI-related helper functions and custom hooks within the Novu JavaScript package, re-exporting them for easier access and organization.

This file provides a utility function `buildContextKey` that generates a compact, stable string key from context objects by extracting only `type:id` pairs, ignoring large data payloads. It is used to create consistent keys for purposes like React dependency arrays or Web Locks API channel names.
This file defines a React functional component named `Lock` that renders an SVG icon representing a lock. It is intended for use within a user interface.
This file serves as a barrel file, exporting all individual UI icons from the `icons` directory for easier access and import throughout the application.

This directory is intended to house components, utilities, and integrations specifically designed for the Next.js framework within the Novu project's framework package. Its role is to provide seamless support and functionality for Novu when developing applications using Next.js.

This README provides instructions and examples for using Novu's React SDK to integrate an inbox notification experience into web applications, covering installation, configuration, and security features like HMAC encryption.
This file is the changelog for the @novu/react package, documenting all version releases, new features, bug fixes, and contributors.

This file serves as the main entry point for the Novu React SDK, re-exporting essential types, components, and hooks from both the core Novu JavaScript library and local React-specific implementations.

This file defines a React context (`RendererContext`) and associated types for managing and mounting React elements within a rendering system. It provides hooks and a provider for accessing and updating the state of mounted elements.
This file establishes and manages the NovuUI instance within a React application using a context. It provides a provider component and hooks for accessing the NovuUI context value.
This file re-exports all theme-related exports from the '@novu/js/themes' package, serving as a consolidated entry point for theme definitions within the React package.

This file defines a React hook `useSchedule` that fetches and manages a user's schedule data from the Novu API, providing states for loading, errors, and the schedule itself, along with a refetch mechanism.

This file serves as a barrel file, re-exporting various React hooks and components (like `NovuProvider` and `useNovu`) along with types and enums from the `@novu/js` library, making them collectively available from a single entry point.

This file defines the NovuProvider component and associated hooks (useNovu) for a React application, enabling the initialization and provision of the Novu SDK client to child components via React Context.

This file defines a React hook `useSubscriptions` for fetching and managing topic subscriptions from the Novu API. It provides real-time updates and state management for subscriptions associated with a given topic key.

This file defines a React hook, `useBrowserTabsChannel`, which facilitates communication between different browser tabs using the BroadcastChannel API. It allows components to post messages to and listen for messages from other tabs under a specified channel name.

This file defines a React hook, `useWebSocketEvent`, that listens to a specified Novu WebSocket event, ensuring only one browser tab registers the listener at a time, and then broadcasts the event data to other tabs via a broadcast channel.
This file serves as an internal entry point for the React package, re-exporting the `buildSubscriber` utility from the core Novu JavaScript library.

This file provides a utility function `createContextAndHook` for easily creating a React Context along with two custom hooks to consume its value: one that asserts the context exists, and another that returns an optional value. It also includes an `assertContextExists` helper function.
This file provides a utility function to adapt React-specific appearance objects, including icon renderers, into a generic JavaScript appearance format consumable by the Novu JS UI library.

This file defines React-specific type aliases and interfaces for Novu components, primarily for customizing UI rendering, theme overrides, and component properties. It bridges Novu's core types with React's ecosystem, enabling flexible component usage and customization.

This React component, `Mounter`, provides a mechanism to mount external, non-React content or components into a specified DOM node within a React application. It uses a ref and `useEffect` to call a provided `mount` function, handling both initial mounting and optional cleanup.

This file defines a React `Renderer` component that dynamically mounts and unmounts elements into the DOM using portals, and a `withRenderer` higher-order component that wraps other components with this rendering capability.
This file serves as a barrel file, re-exporting various React components and hooks to provide a consolidated public API for the Novu React package.

This file defines a visually hidden React component, `ShadowRootDetector`, designed to assist in detecting or interacting with the Shadow DOM environment where it is rendered. It provides a referenceable DOM element without affecting the visual layout.

This file defines the `SubscriptionButton` React component, which acts as a wrapper for the Novu UI's subscription button. It integrates the Novu UI component by mounting it with provided topic, identifier, preferences, and event handlers.

This file exports stub React components and hooks, primarily for Server-Side Rendering (SSR) environments, to define the API and prevent build errors until full SSR-compatible components are implemented.

This directory is designated for internal-use components, utilities, or hooks specific to the `@novu/react` package. Its contents are not exposed as part of the public API and are intended for internal consumption within the Novu React ecosystem.

This directory is intended to house server-side specific components or utilities for the Novu React package. It likely contains code for server-side rendering (SSR), API integrations, or other server-only functionalities that complement the client-side React application.

This directory is intended to house the visual themes for the React components or application within the `novu` project. It would contain styling definitions like color palettes, typography, and spacing, enabling consistent theming across the user interface.

This directory is designed to house custom React hooks specific to the Novu React package. It serves as the designated location for reusable UI logic and state management patterns within the Novu frontend components.
This file serves as an entry point for the shared UI module, re-exporting all components and utilities defined within the 'marketing' sub-module.

This file provides a React context provider for integrating LaunchDarkly feature flags into the application. It dynamically configures LaunchDarkly based on environment variables and detected AWS region, ensuring features can be controlled centrally.

This file provides a React context (`SegmentContext`) and a provider component (`SegmentProvider`) to make a Segment analytics service instance available to child components throughout the application.
This file serves as a central index for exporting various icon components used across the dashboard application, making them easily importable from a single location.
This file provides React hooks for accessing feature flags, primarily integrating with LaunchDarkly, but also offering a fallback mechanism to environment variables for boolean and numeric flags.

This file defines a reusable React Button component, styled using `class-variance-authority` (cva) to support multiple visual variants and sizes, and utilizes Radix UI's Slot for polymorphic behavior.
Defines and styles a custom Checkbox component using Radix UI primitives and Tailwind CSS for a consistent look and feel.
This file is the custom App component for a Next.js application, responsible for initializing pages. It wraps all pages with a global layout component.

This file implements a Next.js page that demonstrates how to manage user notification subscriptions using Novu's `useSubscription` and `useCreateSubscription` hooks, allowing users to enable/disable or set conditions for various notification workflows.

This Next.js page serves as a playground or example demonstrating the integration of Novu notifications using `NovuProvider` and its Next.js hooks. It also includes a `StatusProvider` and applies a `NotionTheme` for presentation.

This directory is designated for storing global or component-specific styling definitions for the Next.js playground application. It serves as the primary location for CSS, SCSS, or other styling assets, ensuring a structured approach to managing visual presentation.
This auto-generated file acts as a barrel export for the internal SDK's hooks, consolidating and re-exporting both the hooks and their related types.

This file defines a React Context for the Novu SDK's core client, including a `NovuProvider` component to make the client available throughout a React application and a `useNovuContext` hook to access it.

This directory is designated for server-side code, API routes, or backend logic specific to the Next.js application within the Novu project. As part of the `nextjs` package, its role is to support server-specific functionalities and integrations. Currently, it appears to be a placeholder as no files or subdirectories were discovered.

This README.md introduces the Novu Framework, a Code-First Notifications Workflow SDK. It provides an overview of how to define and serve notification workflows directly within the codebase, along with installation and quickstart examples.
This file contains a modified, hardcoded IIFE version of the `json-schema-faker` library, integrated to resolve HMR and Webpack issues when `@novu/framework` is used in Next.js.

This file defines the `NovuRequestHandler` class, which is responsible for processing incoming requests, dispatching actions (GET/POST), handling errors, and validating HMAC signatures for the Novu framework. It provides a generalized way to integrate Novu workflows into different host frameworks.

This file provides an integration layer for the Novu framework with H3 applications, allowing Novu workflows to be served and handled within an H3 server environment. It defines how to adapt H3 specific requests and responses for Novu's handler.
This file provides the SvelteKit integration for the Novu framework, exporting a `serve` function that adapts SvelteKit request events to Novu's handler to register and serve workflows.

This file provides an Express-specific integration for the Novu framework, enabling developers to serve and register Novu workflows within an Express application by adapting Express request and response objects.

This file serves as a re-export aggregation point for the Novu framework's NestJS integration, combining top-level exports from the main framework and specific NestJS modules into a single, convenient entry point to improve developer experience.

This file provides a Nuxt.js-specific handler (`serve` function) for the Novu framework, adapting H3's request and response handling for Novu's internal request processing. It allows Novu applications to integrate seamlessly within a Nuxt.js environment.

This file provides the Remix-specific integration for the Novu framework, allowing developers to serve and register Novu workflows within a Remix application. It exports a `serve` function that acts as both a Remix `loader` and `action` to handle incoming requests for Novu workflows.

This file defines the `NovuModuleOptions` interface, specifying the configuration options for integrating the Novu framework with a NestJS application. It includes properties for the API path and optional controller decorators.
This utility file provides a helper function for programmatically applying an array of NestJS class decorators to a given class.

This file defines a NestJS controller (`NovuController`) that acts as an API endpoint, handling GET, POST, and OPTIONS requests by delegating them to a `NovuClient` service. It serves as an integration point for the Novu framework within a NestJS application.
This file defines a configurable NestJS module for Novu using `@nestjs/common`'s `ConfigurableModuleBuilder`, setting up its options and making it globally available by default.
This file defines and re-exports constants used within the NestJS framework integration, including an API registration path and Novu module options.
This file defines the `NovuModule` for NestJS applications, providing methods to integrate the Novu framework, register workflows, and expose them via a configurable API path.

This file provides a NestJS custom provider to dynamically register the API path for the NovuController during application initialization. It ensures the controller's base path can be configured externally.

This file defines the `NovuClient` for the NestJS framework, integrating a generic Novu request handler. It uses NestJS's dependency injection to configure and expose a method for processing incoming requests with Novu's logic.

This file defines a NestJS injectable service that acts as a universal request handler. It abstracts away the differences between Vercel and Express request/response objects, providing a standardized interface for processing HTTP requests within the Novu framework.
Defines the `BridgeError` class, a custom server error specifically for unexpected issues within the Bridge application, such as unsupported runtime environments.
This file defines custom error classes for specific framework-related issues, such as method not allowed, invalid actions, or missing secret keys, within the Novu framework.
Defines the 'SupportedFrameworkName' type, which lists the various server frameworks supported by the Novu framework.

This file defines the TypeScript type 'HealthCheck', which specifies the structure for reporting the health status of a system, including SDK and framework versions, and discovered workflows and steps.

This file serves as a barrel file, aggregating and re-exporting internal modules like constants, errors, filters, schemas, types, and utility functions from the `novu/framework` package for consolidated access.

This directory is intended to house the SvelteKit-specific package or integration for the Novu framework. It would contain components, utilities, or configurations tailored for SvelteKit applications within the Novu ecosystem.

This directory is part of the Novu framework's packages, specifically designed to provide integrations or utilities for the Express.js web framework. Its role is to enable Novu services to leverage Express for building API routes and handling middleware.

This directory is a placeholder for the Novu Remix framework integration. It is intended to house the necessary code and configurations to allow Novu to be used within Remix applications. As it is currently empty, it suggests an incomplete implementation or a target for future development.

This directory is designated to contain the integration or adapter for the H3 HTTP framework within the Novu framework package. It would typically hold modules, utilities, or configurations to enable H3 functionality. Currently, it appears to be an empty placeholder, suggesting either upcoming development or an uninitialized module.
This file contains unit tests for the `CreateChange` use case, verifying its functionality to create changes and detect differences between item versions in the Novu application.
This file defines the Storage API controller responsible for handling requests related to file storage. It provides an endpoint to generate a signed URL for uploading files to the storage service.

This file defines a NestJS controller (`TestingController`) with various endpoints used exclusively for testing purposes. These endpoints are designed to only be accessible when the application is running in a 'test' environment.
This README provides an overview and quick start guide for a simple example project demonstrating how to integrate Novu Framework with NestJS.
This README.md file describes the `@novu/notifications` library, which provides reusable notification templates and workflows for the Novu platform.

This README describes a CLI tool designed to easily integrate Novu's notification inbox component into React or Next.js projects. It guides users through an interactive process to set up the inbox, handling dependencies, configuration, and component creation.

This file contains unit tests for the `detectPackageManager` utility function. It verifies that the function correctly identifies package managers, defaults to npm when none are detected, and handles overrides and mismatches between detected and provided package managers.

This file provides utilities to detect the project's package manager (npm, yarn, pnpm) based on lock files or package.json, and to ensure a package.json file exists, offering to initialize one if missing.

This file defines an `AnalyticsService` class for tracking CLI (Command Line Interface) events and user interactions using Segment analytics. It provides methods to track events, identify users, and manage anonymous IDs, with analytics functionality conditionally enabled based on configuration.

This file is a CLI tool written in TypeScript that automates the integration of the Novu Inbox into React and Next.js projects. It detects the project's framework and package manager, prompts the user for configuration, installs necessary Novu SDKs, generates component structures, and updates environment files.
This file defines API endpoint constants for the Novu bridge, including paths for sync and diff operations. It also specifies constants related to signature timestamp tolerance.

This file serves as the main entry point for the Novu CLI tool, defining commands for syncing application state, starting a local development environment, initializing Novu projects, and managing translations with Novu Cloud.
This file provides a client-side utility for handling command-line interface (CLI) prompts using the 'inquirer' library.

This file defines the `ConfigService` responsible for managing and accessing configuration settings, including authentication tokens and anonymous IDs, for the Novu CLI application using `configstore`.
This file serves as an entry point for the `commands` directory, re-exporting modules related to development and translations.
This file defines and exports a function `showWelcomeScreen` responsible for displaying an animated and colorful welcome message and logo in the console for the Novu application.
This file contains functions for synchronizing data with a Novu bridge via an API, including making authenticated POST requests and building HMAC signatures for security.

This file contains unit tests for the `sync` and `buildSignature` functions. It verifies the behavior of the data synchronization process and the generation of secure signatures, including error handling and signature format validation.
This file defines TypeScript enums for cloud regions (US, EU, STAGING) and their corresponding dashboard URLs. It centralizes environment-specific configuration for different Novu deployments.
This file defines TypeScript types for development command options and local tunnel responses, crucial for configuring and managing the development environment.
This file serves as the main entry point for the 'dev' command within the Novu package. It re-exports the command's implementation and its associated options.
This file implements the `dev` command for a CLI, which sets up a local development environment by establishing a local tunnel, starting a development server, and monitoring endpoint health.

This file contains utility functions for the 'dev' command, including asynchronous waiting, constructing default server origins, determining dashboard URLs based on regions, and parsing/normalizing development command options.

This file defines the `init` command-line function for Novu, responsible for interactively guiding users through the creation and setup of a new Novu project, including project naming, API key validation, and analytics tracking.

This file defines the `createApp` function, which is responsible for initializing and setting up a new Novu application from a template, including creating the directory, installing dependencies, and optionally initializing a Git repository.
This file provides a utility function to validate if a given string is a valid npm package name, wrapping the 'validate-npm-package-name' library.
This file defines a type for package managers and provides a function to detect which package manager ('npm', 'pnpm', 'yarn', or 'bun') is being used based on the user agent string.
This file provides a utility function `copy` for asynchronously copying files and directories using glob patterns, supporting options like renaming and preserving directory structures.
This file provides an asynchronous utility function, `isWriteable`, to check if a given directory has write permissions.

This file provides a utility function to programmatically install package dependencies using a specified package manager. It handles offline scenarios and sets relevant environment variables for the installation process.

This file provides utility functions for fetching information about GitHub repositories and examples, as well as downloading and extracting their contents. It is designed to help initialize projects by retrieving templates or example code from GitHub.

This file provides a utility function `isFolderEmpty` that checks if a directory contains any files or folders that might conflict with a new project setup, ignoring common system and version control files. If conflicts are found, it logs them to the console and returns false.

This file provides utility functions for interacting with Git, primarily to initialize a new Git repository, check for existing repositories, and perform an initial commit, including setting the default branch.

This script provides an interactive command-line interface (CLI) for setting up, running, and testing the Novu project. It guides developers through initial environment checks, dependency installation, and offers options to start various project components or run tests.

This file is responsible for detecting the project's frontend framework (Next.js or React), extracting its version from package.json, and validating if it meets the minimum required version. It provides utilities for framework identification and version management within a project.

This file is the Tailwind CSS configuration for a JavaScript project, defining custom theme properties like colors, border radii, shadows, font sizes, and animations, often utilizing CSS variables for dynamic theming. It also specifies content paths, a class prefix, and includes the 'tailwindcss-animate' plugin.

This file contains Playwright end-to-end tests for a demo ToDo application, covering functionalities such as adding, completing, editing, deleting, and filtering todo items. It serves as an example or benchmark for Playwright test setups.
This file serves as the main entry point for the Segment context, re-exporting its hooks and the SegmentProvider component for use throughout the application.

This file defines the `ResourceRow` React component, which displays details for a single resource item, including its type-specific icon, name, identifier, and last update information. It is used to present resource differences or list resources in a dashboard.

This file defines the `AiDrawerProvider` component, which manages the open/closed state and initial query for an AI-powered drawer. It uses a React context to expose drawer control functions and state to its children components.

This file defines a React context and a custom hook (`useAiDrawer`) for managing the state and actions (open/close) of an AI drawer component. It allows other components to access and manipulate the AI drawer's visibility.

This file defines the types and interfaces for the command palette feature, including command categories, priorities, the structure of a command, command groups, the palette's state, and its execution context.
This file serves as the main entry point for the command palette feature, aggregating and exporting its core components, types, and hooks for the dashboard application.

This file defines and exports a set of help-related commands for a command palette in the Novu dashboard. These commands allow users to access documentation, provide feedback, or interact with an AI assistant.
This file provides UI components for a support or documentation drawer, including cards for suggested articles, an iframe for embedding documentation, and interactive footer links.
This file defines a React component named `NovuIcon` which renders the Novu logo as an SVG icon. It allows for custom SVG properties to be passed down.
This file defines a React component, `LogoCircle`, that renders an SVG representing a circular logo with gradient fills.
This file defines a React component for a 'version control development' icon, rendered as an SVG. It visually represents a development or staging environment within a version control context.
This file defines and exports a set of styled and customized AlertDialog components, built upon Radix UI primitives and integrated with Tailwind CSS for consistent styling within the application.

This React component displays the content for a single-selection filter within a faceted filtering interface, using radio buttons for options. It provides functionality for selection, searching, and keyboard navigation.

This file defines data structures and functions to generate installation instructions and code snippets for integrating Novu's notification inbox component across various frontend frameworks (e.g., Next.js, React, Angular), supporting different installation methods (CLI, manual, AI-assist).
This file defines and exports React functional components for SVG icons, including a 'PointingArrow' and the 'NovuLogo', intended for use within the application's UI.

This component provides a guide for integrating different inbox frameworks, allowing users to select a framework and an installation method to display tailored setup instructions. It dynamically updates code snippets and instructions based on the user's choices.

This file defines the `ResourcesList` React component, which displays a horizontally scrollable and animated list of welcome resources. Each resource includes an image, title, and optional duration, and user interactions are tracked via telemetry.

This file defines the `InboxEmbed` React component, which guides users through connecting and configuring the in-app inbox integration. It renders different setup guides or a connected view based on the integration's status and environment settings.

This file defines animation variants and transitions using a library like Framer Motion for various UI components within a welcome or progress section. It specifies how elements like cards, sections, text, lists, steps, and logos should animate between hidden and visible states.

This file implements React components for displaying interactive framework installation guides. It includes features for step-by-step instructions, code blocks with package manager selection, and copy-to-clipboard functionality.

This file provides a utility to generate framework-specific integration prompts for Novu, incorporating application and regional configuration details. It helps users get tailored setup guidance based on their chosen framework and environment.

This file defines a constant object, `FRAMEWORK_CONFIGS`, which stores configuration details (specifically display names) for various frontend frameworks such as Next.js, React, Angular, and Vue. It likely populates options or categorizations within the application's dashboard.
This file serves as an index for exporting AI prompt strings specifically tailored for various JavaScript frameworks, consolidating access to these framework-specific prompts.
This file defines the configuration interface for AI prompt generation and provides a utility function to replace placeholder variables within prompt strings with actual configuration values.

This file defines a detailed prompt for an AI agent, outlining step-by-step instructions and guidelines for integrating the Novu Inbox component into vanilla JavaScript applications. It includes objectives, constraints, and an implementation checklist for a seamless integration process.

This file defines instructions and a template for an AI agent tasked with integrating the Novu Inbox component into React applications. It includes a detailed checklist for integration steps, critical constraints, and example code snippets for implementation.

This file defines a detailed prompt and guidelines for an AI agent tasked with integrating the Novu Inbox component into a Remix application. It outlines objectives, constraints, and an implementation checklist for the integration process.

This file contains a detailed prompt and configuration for an AI agent, guiding it on how to integrate, customize, and properly style the Novu Inbox component within a Next.js application, including steps for package installation, environment variable configuration, subscriber ID detection, and appearance customization.

This file defines a detailed prompt and associated code snippets for an AI agent, guiding it on how to integrate the Novu Inbox notification component into Vue.js applications following best practices.

This file defines a `FrameworkGrid` component responsible for rendering a grid of `FrameworkCard` components. It displays a list of frameworks, highlights the currently selected one, and provides a mechanism for selecting a different framework.

This file defines the `HeaderSection` React component, which displays a welcome or guide header for an inbox integration setup. It includes an animated loader and text indicating that it's watching for the integration process.

This file defines React components for displaying framework installation instructions. It includes a selector for different installation methods (AI Assist, CLI, Manual) and dynamically renders the appropriate instructions based on the selected framework and method.

This helper file contains a function to dynamically update placeholder code within framework installation steps. It replaces generic identifiers with specific environment, subscriber, and color values for personalized code snippets.

This file defines the `FrameworkCard` React component, which displays an individual framework with its icon and name. It provides visual feedback for selection and hover states using animation, and handles user clicks to select a framework.

This file contains utility functions for generating code snippets (Node.js, cURL, PHP, Python, Go) and Postman collections to trigger Novu notification workflows, accommodating different environments and authentication methods.

This file generates a comprehensive AI prompt designed to instruct an AI agent on how to integrate Novu workflow triggers into different application codebases, providing language-specific code snippets and a detailed implementation checklist.

This file defines a React hook that extracts specific URL query parameters such as 'code', 'next', 'edit', and 'configurationId', primarily for handling Vercel-related contexts or integrations within the application.

This file defines the `UpdateVercelIntegration` use case, responsible for updating existing Vercel integrations by managing environment variables on Vercel projects and synchronizing bridge URLs for Novu environments.
This file provides a comprehensive checklist for conducting code reviews. It covers aspects such as functionality, code quality, and security to ensure thorough evaluation.
This file provides a detailed guide for creating a well-structured pull request, including steps for branch preparation, PR description writing, and setup with proper labels and reviewers.

This file provides a comprehensive guide and quick reference for integrating and configuring the Better Auth TypeScript authentication framework, covering its features, options, and common usage patterns.
This file defines and renders the header navigation for a Next.js application, categorizing links for various playground examples and customization options.

This file defines a React component (`SideNav`) that renders a categorised navigation sidebar for a Next.js application. It displays a list of links grouped by category, highlighting the currently active route.
Defines a basic Next.js API route that responds with a simple JSON object containing a name. This serves as a standard 'Hello, World!' example for API endpoints.

This file provides a comprehensive integration guide for the Better Auth TypeScript authentication framework. It details configuration options, database setup, session management, security features, plugins, and client usage for developers.

This file is the README for Novu's JavaScript SDK, providing instructions on installation, getting started, and advanced features like HMAC encryption and socket options for building custom in-app notification experiences.
This file is a test or example script demonstrating the usage of the Novu SDK to initialize the client and list notifications for a given subscriber.

This file is a changelog for the JavaScript package, documenting all notable changes including new features, bug fixes, and other improvements across different versions. It helps users and developers understand the evolution of the package.

This file contains unit tests for the `BaseModule` class's `callWithSession` method. It verifies its behavior when a session is initialized, not yet initialized, or fails to initialize, ensuring callbacks are invoked appropriately.

This file exposes the `Novu` class globally on the `window` object. It acts as an entry point for a UMD (Universal Module Definition) build, making the Novu library accessible in browser environments.
This file serves as the main entry point for the Novu JavaScript SDK, aggregating and re-exporting various types, classes, and utility functions from its internal modules to form the public API.

This file defines the main Novu client-side class, `Novu`, which acts as the primary interface for interacting with the Novu API. It manages user sessions, notifications, preferences, subscriptions, and provides real-time event handling.

This file declares global types and constants for the Novu library, making `NOVU_API_VERSION`, `PACKAGE_NAME`, `PACKAGE_VERSION` available globally and adding the `Novu` type to the global `Window` object.

This file contains unit tests for the Novu SDK, specifically verifying its HTTP client interactions for session management and notification fetching, and its socket connection initialization with custom options.
This file defines a base module that manages the initialization and state of a user session, queuing dependent operations until the session is successfully established or handling session errors.

This file defines common types, interfaces, and enums used across the Novu JavaScript SDK, covering aspects like notifications, subscribers, preferences, and API options. It serves as a central registry for data structures within the Novu client library.
This file serves as an API entry point, re-exporting modules related to HTTP client functionality and inbox services for the Novu JavaScript package.
This file contains unit tests for the `HttpClient` class, verifying its functionality for making HTTP requests, handling authorization, headers, and various response scenarios.
This file defines an `HttpClient` class responsible for making HTTP requests to the Novu API, handling API versioning, authorization, custom headers, and response parsing, including error handling.
This file serves as the main entry point for the event-emitter module, re-exporting its core event emitter functionality and associated types.
This file defines the `NovuEventEmitter` class, which provides an event-driven communication mechanism within the Novu application using the `mitt` library for event handling.
This file defines the TypeScript types and interfaces for all events emitted by the Novu Event Emitter, categorizing them by module and action, including their pending and resolved states.

This file defines constants used for testing purposes, specifically a test user's password.

This file defines a `TestingQueueService` that encapsulates a BullMQ queue, configured to connect to Redis using environment variables. It is designed for creating and managing queues within a testing context.

This file defines utility classes, `TestServer` and `WsTestServer`, for managing and interacting with application instances during testing, including setup, service retrieval, and teardown for both standard and WebSocket applications.
This file serves as the main entry point for the testing library, re-exporting various services, utilities, and mocks used for testing purposes within the Novu application.

This file defines the `DalService` class, which is responsible for establishing and managing the connection to a MongoDB database using Mongoose. It handles connection, disconnection, status checks, and can drop the database in test environments.
This file acts as a barrel file for the Data Access Layer (DAL), re-exporting core services, types, and all data repositories to consolidate exports and simplify imports from this library.
This file defines default schema options, including settings for timestamps, ID generation, and virtualization for JSON and object conversions, likely used in an ORM context.
This file serves as an entry point for the 'control-values' data access layer, aggregating and re-exporting its entity definition, repository, and schema.
This file serves as an entry point to export constants related to Time To Live (TTL) values, likely consolidating them for easier access within the `dal` library.

This file defines constants and a utility function for managing Time-To-Live (TTL) configurations. It specifies an expiration duration and determines if TTL indexing should be enabled based on environment variables.
This file serves as an index for exceptions within the Data Access Layer (DAL), re-exporting the `dal.exception` for consolidated access.
This file serves as a re-export entry point, aggregating and making accessible all types defined in the sibling 'index.type.ts' file.

This directory is intended to house the TypeScript configuration files specifically for the 'maily' library. It defines how TypeScript compiles and transpiles code within that distinct library module, ensuring consistent type-checking and build settings.

This directory is intended to house Docker-related configurations or build contexts specifically for local development or testing environments. Although currently empty, it likely serves as a placeholder for local Docker setups within the Novu project.

This README provides instructions and guidance for setting up and running a self-hosted Novu instance using Docker and Docker Compose. It covers quick start, managing services, and initial configuration.

This directory is intended to house Docker-related configurations specifically tailored for the community aspect of the Novu project. It likely serves as a designated space for open-source contributions or community-driven deployment setups for Novu's Dockerized environment.
This TypeScript declaration file defines custom environment variables and their types for a Cloudflare Socket Worker, including a Durable Object namespace for WebSocket rooms and a JWT secret.
This file defines core TypeScript interfaces for environment variables, WebSocket connection metadata, and WebSocket room management within a socket worker service.

Provider & Channel Integrations.description: Manages a large collection of third-party communication providers for Email, SMS, Push, and Chat. It allows for centralized configuration, credential management, and handles incoming webhooks for status updates.

files.description: This file is a changelog documenting the releases for the 'providers' package, including new features, bug fixes, dependency updates, and contributors for each version.

This README provides an overview and usage instructions for the `@novu/providers` package. It details how this collection of stateless notification delivery providers abstracts underlying implementation details for sending notifications across various channels.

This file defines the abstract BaseProvider class, which provides core functionalities for handling data transformation and casing for different API providers, including merging various data sources and applying specific casing conventions to keys.
This file serves as the main entry point for the 'providers' package, re-exporting all modules from its './lib' directory to create a consolidated public interface.
This file serves as the main entry point for the 'providers' library, aggregating and re-exporting modules for various communication channels like chat, email, push, and SMS.

This README.md file provides installation instructions and usage examples for the `@novu/stateless` package, which enables sending notifications through various channels and providers. It lists supported email, SMS, push, chat, and in-app notification providers.
This file is a changelog that documents all the version-specific changes, new features, and bug fixes for the 'stateless' package within the Novu project.
This file defines TypeScript interfaces for events that occur before and after sending messages, including details like channel type, message content, and trigger payload.

This file contains unit tests for the `EmailHandler` class, verifying its functionality including handling email subjects (string or function), message templates, attachments, and interaction with the email provider's `sendMessage` method.
This file defines the `EmailHandler` class, responsible for processing email templates, compiling content, applying themes, and sending emails via an email provider based on a trigger payload.
This file contains unit tests for the `ProviderStore` class, verifying its functionality for registering and retrieving providers by ID or channel type.
This file defines the `ProviderStore` class, which manages and stores various notification providers (SMS, Email, Chat, Push) allowing for their retrieval by ID or channel type.

This file defines an enumeration (enum) listing possible responses or statuses when checking the validity or status of an integration, such as success, failure, or specific error conditions like invalid credentials.

This file defines core interfaces for various communication channel providers (email, SMS, chat, push) in a stateless manner. It includes definitions for message options, event structures, and integration check responses specific to each channel type.
Defines custom error classes for provider-related issues, such as a provider not being found or an execution failing, extending more general resource error types.

This file defines core TypeScript types for integrating and configuring various providers within a framework. It includes types for passthrough data and the main `Providers` type, which maps step types to functions handling controls, outputs, and returning schema-validated data with optional passthrough information.
Defines JSON schemas for email channel output and results, specifying the structure for email content like subject, body, and sender information.
This file aggregates and exports provider schemas for various communication channels (chat, SMS, email, push, in-app) within the Novu framework, serving as a central point for schema management.
Defines the JSON schema for Novu in-app provider output. Currently, the output schema is an empty object, indicating no specific properties are expected.
This file aggregates and exports schema definitions for different in-app notification providers, currently including the Novu in-app provider schema.
This file acts as an index for the `bridge` DTO (Data Transfer Object) module, re-exporting all exports from `bridge.interface.ts` to provide a consolidated entry point for bridge-related interfaces.
This file defines enums for various credential keys and IDs for different types of notification providers (email, SMS, chat, push, in-app) used within the Novu platform.

This file serves as an index for re-exporting various provider-related constants and interfaces within the shared package. It consolidates exports from credentials, provider interfaces, and other provider-specific definitions.
This file aggregates and exports configurations for various notification providers (email, SMS, chat, in-app, push) and defines constants for Novu-specific provider IDs.
This file defines interfaces and types for configuring different providers, including their credentials, general settings, and display properties, within the Novu application.

This file defines the specific credential requirements and configurations for various notification service providers (e.g., mail, SMS). It uses a structured format to list keys, display names, types, and validation rules for each provider's setup.

This file serves as a central index, re-exporting constants related to various communication channels (chat, email, in-app, push, sms) from their respective modules within the shared providers constants.
This file defines the configuration for in-app providers, specifically detailing the Novu In-App provider with its credentials, display information, and documentation link.
This file defines the interface for various integration configuration settings. It includes properties for webhook settings, push resources, and an enum for inbox count types.

Defines the `ICredentials` interface, which serves as a generic structure for storing various authentication and configuration details required for different integrations and services within the Novu platform. It includes optional fields for API keys, user credentials, server details, and service-specific parameters.

This file defines the `GetBridgeStatus` use case, responsible for executing a health check on a given bridge URL. It leverages the `ExecuteBridgeRequest` to perform this action and returns the health status.

This file defines the `GetBridgeStatusCommand` class, which is a command object used to request the status of a bridge. It extends `EnvironmentLevelCommand` and can optionally include a `statelessBridgeUrl`.

Defines the command structure for sending a test email within the Novu application. It encapsulates all necessary parameters like recipient, content, subject, and optional configurations for the email sending process.

This file defines a NestJS use case for sending a test email. It handles selecting an email integration, compiling email content from templates or bridge services, and dispatching the email using the chosen provider.
This file defines a TypeScript enum, `ChatOrPushProviderEnum`, listing various chat and push notification service providers, along with their corresponding Zod schemas for validation and type safety.

Defines the `ChannelCredentials` type, which encapsulates various channel-specific authentication or configuration details for different integration types. It includes Zod schemas for validation and functions for JSON serialization/deserialization of this model.

This file defines the `ChannelCTATypeEnum`, an enumeration for different types of call-to-action actions, currently only including 'redirect'. It is a generated file for the internal SDK, likely used for API modeling.

This file defines the `ChannelTypeEnum` which enumerates various message channel types (e.g., in-app, email, SMS) and includes Zod schemas for their validation. It's used within an internal SDK to specify the channel through which messages are sent.
This file defines an enumeration for various types of integration issues within the system, using Zod for schema validation.

This file defines the `EmailChannelOverrides` type, representing settings to override email channel properties like the layout ID. It includes a Zod schema for validation and a function to serialize it to JSON, likely auto-generated by Speakeasy.
This file defines the `MessageActionStatusEnum`, an enumeration representing the possible statuses of a message action (e.g., pending, done), and includes its corresponding Zod schema for validation.
This file defines the `MessageStatusEnum` enum, specifying possible statuses for messages (e.g., 'sent', 'error', 'warning'), and includes its Zod schema definition for validation.

This file defines an enumeration (`ProvidersIdEnum`) of various provider IDs used for different communication channels (email, SMS, push, chat) within the system. It also includes corresponding Zod schemas for type validation.

This file defines the `ThrottleControlDto` Data Transfer Object, including its schema, associated enums (type and unit), and utility functions for serializing and deserializing throttle control configurations, likely for API communication.
This file serves as a central index for re-exporting various email provider modules, making them easily accessible from a single entry point within the application's 'providers' package.

This file implements an email provider for the Braze platform, enabling applications to send emails via the Braze API. It handles message creation, user ID mapping, and integration checks specific to Braze.
This file contains unit tests for the Braze email provider, specifically verifying the functionality of its `sendMessage` method using Vitest.
This file defines the interface for configuring EmailJS email provider settings, including sender, host, port, security, and authentication details.
This file implements an email provider for the emailjs library, handling email sending, client initialization, and integration checks within the Novu framework.

This file contains unit tests for the EmailJsProvider, verifying its functionality for sending emails and checking integration status. It uses Vitest for testing the `sendMessage` and `checkIntegration` methods.
This file implements the Mailgun email provider for the Novu notification system. It handles sending emails, configuring webhooks, verifying signatures, and parsing event data from Mailgun.

This file contains unit tests for the MailtrapEmailProvider, verifying its functionality for sending emails and checking integration status using the Mailtrap API.

This file contains unit tests for the `MailjetEmailProvider` class, ensuring it correctly integrates with the Mailjet API for sending emails and checking integration status.

This file implements the Mailjet email provider for Novu, handling email sending functionality and processing Mailjet-specific email event webhooks. It abstracts the Mailjet API for sending emails, checking integration, and parsing event statuses.

This file implements an email provider for MailerSend, enabling sending emails and checking integration status through the MailerSend API within the Novu framework.

This file contains unit tests for the Postmark email provider, verifying its functionality for sending emails, handling passthrough options, retrieving message IDs, parsing webhooks, and checking integration status.

This file contains unit tests for the `ResendEmailProvider`, ensuring it correctly constructs and sends email messages via the Resend API, including handling attachments, sender names, and passthrough options.
This file implements an email provider for the Resend service, enabling sending emails, checking integration status, and processing Resend webhooks for event tracking and signature verification.

It conditionally loads Intercom based on the `INTERCOM_APP_ID` and the presence of current user and organization details.

This file defines the data structure for the result of a chat OAuth callback operation, including the type of response (HTML or URL) and the corresponding result string.
This file contains unit tests for the `@IsNotEmpty()` validator. It verifies that the validator correctly identifies and flags null, undefined, and empty string values for a field.

This file handles the OAuth callback for chat integrations, exchanging an authorization code for a webhook URL, and then uses it to either create a new channel endpoint or update an existing subscriber channel. It is marked as deprecated, suggesting a transition to newer channel management modules.

This file defines the `ChatOauth` use case, responsible for orchestrating the OAuth process for chat providers like Slack. It generates the necessary OAuth URL, retrieves integration credentials, and performs HMAC validation for secure authentication.
