This file defines a NestJS `ZodValidationPipe` that uses Zod schemas to validate incoming request bodies. It ensures that the request body conforms to a specified schema, throwing a `ZodError` if validation fails.
This file provides utility functions for manipulating JSON objects, including flattening nested structures, converting flat structures back to nested, and merging objects with array concatenation.
This file defines a NestJS pipe (`LimitPipe`) that validates if a number falls within a specified minimum and maximum range, optionally allowing `null` or `undefined` values.

This file contains unit tests for the `LimitPipe` class, which validates and transforms numeric limit values. It verifies that the pipe correctly enforces minimum and maximum limits, handles optional inputs, and throws appropriate exceptions for invalid values.
This file implements a mock HTTP client for testing purposes, allowing pre-configured responses to specific API requests and recording all interactions.

This NestJS interceptor automatically transforms class instances within API responses into plain JavaScript objects using `class-transformer`. It ensures a consistent response structure, handling both single objects and arrays, and preserves existing data wrappers for paginated results.
This file defines a custom error class, `PlatformException`, for handling platform-specific exceptions within the application.

This file provides utilities for managing a unique machine ID and retrieving system-level machine information. It generates or loads a persistent machine ID and gathers details like hostname, memory, platform, and IP address.
This file implements a Python library for manipulating IPv4 and IPv6 addresses and networks, providing functionalities to create, analyze, summarize, and collapse IP ranges.
This script retrieves a list of DNS server IP addresses by scouring the Windows registry for various operating system versions (NT4, 2000, XP, ME).

This file defines constants for DNS CLASS values (e.g., IN, CS, CH, HS, ANY) as specified in RFCs. It also provides a utility function to convert these numeric class values to their string representations.
This file initializes and exports a Winston logger instance configured for console output with debug-level logging and pretty printing. It provides a centralized logging utility for the application.
This file defines a NestJS interceptor that transforms outgoing API response data into a plain object format, ensuring consistency and proper serialization for non-GraphQL routes.
This file provides a utility function to escape special regular expression characters within a string. This ensures the string can be safely used as a literal part of a regex pattern.
This file defines a React component named `Title` which takes a string `title` as a prop and renders it as an `h3` heading.
Defines a reusable UI switch (toggle) component, built upon Radix UI's Switch primitives and styled with custom inline styles for a Next.js application.
This file defines and exports a set of customized UI components for a Popover, built upon the Radix UI Popover primitive and styled with Tailwind CSS.

This file defines and exports a comprehensive set of styled UI components for a dropdown menu, built upon Radix UI's primitives. It includes components for the menu, trigger, content, items, labels, separators, and sub-menus, applying custom styling (likely Tailwind CSS) and icons.

This utility file provides a function `cn` to safely merge and combine Tailwind CSS class names. It uses `clsx` for conditional class joining and `tailwind-merge` to resolve conflicting classes, ensuring a clean and effective final class string.
This file provides a utility function `cn` that intelligently merges CSS class names, including Tailwind CSS classes, for use in components.
This file defines the `Logger` TypeScript interface, specifying methods for structured logging operations like grouping and basic message logging. It appears to be a generated SDK component.
This file provides utility functions for handling file-related operations, including converting a readable stream to an ArrayBuffer and determining the MIME content type based on a file's extension.

This file provides a utility function, `dlv`, for deeply accessing properties within an object using a string or array key path, returning an optional default value if the path does not exist. It is a generated Speakeasy client file for deep property lookup.
This file provides utility functions for converting between strings, Uint8Arrays, and Base64 encoding/decoding. It also defines Zod schemas for handling these data types in an SDK context.

This file defines a flexible HTTP client (`HTTPClient`) with support for request/response hooks, and provides utility functions for matching HTTP content types, status codes, and identifying various network errors (connection, timeout, abort errors).

This file provides utility functions for constructing URLs from a path pattern and a set of parameters. It dynamically replaces placeholders in the path with provided values, with an option for URL encoding.

This file implements robust retry mechanisms for HTTP requests, including backoff strategies and custom error types to control retry behavior. It allows for retrying on specific HTTP status codes, connection errors, and timeouts.

Provides utility functions for encoding various data types into string formats for API requests, supporting different serialization styles such as matrix, label, form, deep object, and JSON, as part of a Speakeasy-generated SDK.

This file defines utility types and functions for working with enums in TypeScript, specifically for integrating them with the Zod validation library. It provides methods to create Zod schemas for both string and numeric enums, handling both known values and unrecognized or 'open' enum cases.

This file provides a type guard function `isReadableStream` to safely check if an unknown value is an instance of a ReadableStream, specifically checking for the presence of key methods like `getReader`, `cancel`, and `tee`.

This file defines utilities for type-checking and validating Blob-like objects using Zod. It includes a schema (`blobLikeSchema`) and a helper function (`isBlobLike`) to identify Blobs, Files, or objects with similar characteristics.

This file defines utility types and a custom Promise class (`APIPromise`) for handling asynchronous API calls. It allows for introspection of the API call's status, request, and response, beyond just the resolved data.

This file provides a Zod-based parser for discriminated unions that gracefully handles unknown discriminator values, returning a special 'Unknown' type while preserving the raw input. It also tracks unrecognized values during parsing.

This file defines a `Result` type and utility functions (`OK`, `ERR`, `unwrap`, `unwrapAsync`) for functional error handling. It implements a railway programming pattern to manage operation outcomes, offering a type-safe alternative to traditional exception handling.
Defines an enumeration for sorting direction (ascending or descending) and provides its corresponding Zod schema for validation, generated by Speakeasy.
This file defines a reusable `BaseButton` React component that supports various styles (variants) and sizes, leveraging Tailwind CSS for styling and Radix UI's Slot component for render flexibility.
This file defines and exports a reusable `Textarea` React component, which renders a styled HTML textarea element with Tailwind CSS classes for consistent UI.
Defines a reusable React UI component for rendering a horizontal or vertical divider line, customizable with CSS classes.

This file defines and styles a comprehensive set of reusable Dropdown Menu components using Radix UI primitives and Tailwind CSS for custom styling. It exports various parts of a dropdown menu, including trigger, content, items, labels, and sub-menus.
This file defines a reusable React `ColorPicker` component that provides a hexadecimal color input, a color picker UI, and options for displaying suggested colors, all within a popover.
This file defines a reusable React `Select` UI component, providing a customizable dropdown input with an optional icon and tooltip integration for an editor.

This file defines a reusable React `NumberInput` component that provides a styled numeric input field. It includes features like optional icons, tooltips, and constraints for minimum and maximum values.
This file provides utility functions for calculating aspect ratios and deriving image dimensions (width or height) based on a given aspect ratio.
This file provides a utility function `cn` for conditionally combining and merging Tailwind CSS class names, using `clsx` and `tailwind-merge` with a custom 'mly-' prefix.

This file defines a collection of predefined border-radius options with descriptive names and their corresponding pixel values. It serves as a utility for standardizing border-radius styles within the Maily editor.

This file defines a `useEvent` custom React hook that provides a stable, memoized reference to a callback function, ensuring that the latest handler is always called without causing unnecessary re-renders.
This file exports a utility function that adjusts the scroll position of a container element to ensure a specified item element is visible within its scroll view, adding a small offset.
This file defines a constant object used to disable browser autocomplete and instruct password managers to ignore input fields, likely for components within the Maily editor.

This file defines a set of standard spacing values (e.g., 'xs', 'sm', 'md') along with their corresponding numerical values. It likely serves as a utility for consistent spacing within an editor or UI component.
This file serves as an entry point for utility functions within the testing library, re-exporting modules like `processTestAgentExpectedStatusCode`.
Defines the `SortOrder` type, which represents ascending (1) or descending (-1) order for sorting operations.
Defines interfaces for the results of database delete and update operations, including properties like matchedCount and modifiedCount.
This file defines an enumeration for standardized error codes, specifically for issues like duplicate keys, within the Data Access Layer of the application.

This file serves as a central export point for various types and interfaces used throughout the Data Access Layer (DAL) library, including authentication, enforcement, error enums, helper types, and results, along with a Mongoose ClientSession type.

This file defines a TypeScript utility type, `ChangePropsValueType`, which helps modify the type of specified properties within an object, typically used in the Data Access Layer (DAL) to cast properties to Mongoose's ObjectId type.
This file acts as an entry point for the `repositories` module, re-exporting all exports from `base-repository`.

This file defines a generic base repository class using Mongoose, providing common CRUD operations and query building utilities for interacting with a MongoDB database. It abstracts database interactions for specific data models and entities.

This file serves as an aggregation point, re-exporting shared constants and exception classes for the Data Access Layer (DAL) module. It provides a convenient public interface for these common utilities.
This file defines a custom `DalException` class, used to represent errors occurring within the Data Access Layer (DAL) of the application. It provides a specific error type for DAL-related issues.
This file defines the `IndexDefinition` type, which is a generic type used to specify Mongoose index configurations for any given entity type within the data access layer.
This file describes shared services used internally across various Novu services, clarifying that these services are not intended for general application-level dependencies.

In-App Notification Center.description: Offers a fully-featured, embeddable UI component for web and mobile applications, providing a real-time notification inbox with user preference management and extensive customization options.

files.description: This file defines and exports various constants and types, including supported frameworks, package managers, environment variable mappings, and analytics configuration, for use across the application.

This file acts as a barrel re-exporting various notification-related modules, including individual notifications, collections of notifications, and their associated types, providing a unified entry point for notification functionalities.

This file implements a `NotificationVisibilityTracker` class that monitors the visibility of notification elements in the DOM and automatically marks them as seen via an API after a specified duration, using `IntersectionObserver` and batching mechanisms.

This file serves as the main entry point for the Novu UI module, exporting core types, interfaces, and the `NovuUI` class. It aggregates and re-exports essential definitions for building and configuring the Novu user interface.

This file defines the NovuUI class, which serves as a programmatic interface for mounting, updating, and unmounting Novu UI components within a web application, managing their state and rendering lifecycle using Solid.js.

This file defines TypeScript types and interfaces for UI components, rendering functions, and appearance customization callbacks within the Novu notification system. It covers aspects like notification handlers, style variables, and callback structures for inbox elements, preferences, and notifications.
This file serves as the main entry point for UI themes, specifically re-exporting the dark theme to make it available for use.
This file defines the dark theme configurations for the Novu UI components, including color variables and element-specific styles for the inbox and subscription interfaces.
This file serves as a public interface for UI components, re-exporting various elements, primitives, and subscription-related components from subdirectories.

This file defines the main Inbox UI component for a Solid.js application, including its popover trigger (bell icon) and the content of the inbox itself. It handles displaying notifications, managing user preferences, and navigating between these views, supporting various rendering customizations.

This file defines the `Renderer` SolidJS component responsible for dynamically mounting and displaying various Novu UI components (e.g., Inbox, Bell, Subscription) into specified DOM elements, along with managing their context providers and injecting necessary global styles.
This file acts as a barrel file, re-exporting the `InboxTabs` component from its local module to provide a unified entry point for external consumption.

This file defines the `InboxTabs` SolidJS component, which renders a tabbed interface for an inbox. It manages active tabs, displays notification lists filtered by the selected tab, and includes a dropdown for handling an overflow of tabs.
This file serves as an index for UI components, re-exporting various elements such as Bell, Footer, Header, Preferences, and Root for consolidated access.

This file defines the `Root` Solid.js component, which serves as the main container for Novu UI elements. It applies base styling, handles branding, and sets up the primary DOM element for the Novu widget or application.
This file acts as a barrel file, re-exporting the 'Header' component from its sibling file, making it easily importable from this directory.

This component renders a dropdown menu providing 'more actions' for a notification within an inbox, specifically when the notification is neither archived nor snoozed. It displays a 'dots' icon that, when clicked, reveals additional options related to the notification.
This file defines constant objects that map notification statuses to their corresponding localization keys, used for displaying options and labels in an inbox filtering UI component.

This file defines Solid.js components (`StatusOptions`, `StatusItem`) for displaying and selecting various notification statuses within an inbox UI. It allows users to change a notification's status (e.g., read, unread, archived, snoozed) with localized labels and icons.
This file serves as the main entry point for the Bell UI component, re-exporting its definition.

This Solid.js component renders a notification bell icon, dynamically applying styles and a glow effect based on the highest severity of unread messages, and displays a notification dot if there are any unread items.
This file defines a utility array `weekDays` listing the days of the week. It is likely used for UI components related to scheduling or preferences.

This component displays a list of user preferences, grouped by category, handling loading states and enabling updates to individual or bulk preferences. It serves as a container for `GroupedPreferencesRow` components.

This file serves as the main entry point for the 'Preferences' component, re-exporting all its public interfaces. It simplifies imports for other parts of the application needing to use the Preferences UI element.

This file defines a SolidJS component, PreferencesRow, responsible for displaying a single user preference or workflow. It includes functionality to show/hide the associated communication channels and manage their states within a collapsible UI element.

This Solid.js component, `DefaultPreferences`, displays a list of user workflow preferences. It renders each preference as a `PreferencesRow` and provides functionality to update them, showing a skeleton loader while data is being fetched.

This file defines the `ScheduleTable` component, which provides a UI for users to view and modify their weekly notification schedule preferences, including enabling/disabling specific days and setting time ranges.

This file defines the `ScheduleRow` component, which provides a collapsible UI element for managing a user's notification or preference schedule, including its enabled state and detailed weekly schedule.

This Solid.js component renders a collapsible row for a group of user preferences, allowing users to manage notification settings for the entire group and its associated channels, including bulk updates.

This file defines a UI component, `ChannelRow`, for displaying and managing the preference (enabled/disabled) of a single communication channel, such as email, push, or in-app notifications. It includes dynamic icons and labels for different channel types.

This file defines a UI component that displays a skeleton loading state for a list of user notification preferences, featuring animated placeholders for channels and switches. It also includes an empty state message shown when the loading is complete and no preferences are available.

This file defines the `Preferences` component, which provides a user interface for managing notification preferences within an inbox, allowing users to view and update settings for various channels and workflows.
This file acts as the primary export and entry point for the Notification UI component, consolidating its various sub-components like NotificationActions and NotificationList.
This SolidJS component renders an infinitely scrolling list of user notifications, including new message indicators and custom rendering capabilities for individual notifications.

This file defines the `DefaultNotification` Solid.js component, which renders a single notification within an inbox UI, including its content, actions, and severity-based styling. It handles displaying avatars, subjects, bodies, and managing user interactions like clicks and action completions.

This file defines the `Notification` Solid.js component, which renders a notification item. It supports custom rendering through props or falls back to a `DefaultNotification` component for standard display.

This file defines a Solid.js component called `SnoozeDateTimePicker` that provides an interactive date and time picker for users to select a future time, typically for snoozing a notification, with built-in validation for past times and maximum duration.
This Solid.js component renders a floating call-to-action button that appears when there are new messages, displaying the count and allowing user interaction.
This Solid.js component renders a single subscription preference as a row, displaying a label and a checkbox to enable or disable the preference.

This Solid.js component renders a collapsible row for managing a group of subscription preferences. It allows users to toggle the entire group or individual preferences within it, displaying a checkbox with indeterminate state for the group.

This Solid.js component displays and manages a user's subscription preferences, including grouping and filtering preferences based on workflows or tags. It provides a UI for users to view and interact with their notification preferences within a subscription context.
This file acts as an index for UI configuration, exporting appearance keys, default localization, and default variables for the Novu JavaScript UI package.

This file defines and exports lists of 'appearance keys' (likely CSS class names or styling identifiers) for various UI components across common elements, inbox features, and subscription preferences. The keys are categorized and explain a naming convention for extensions using double underscores.
This file defines a SolidJS hook (`usePreferences`) for fetching user preferences from the Novu API, managing their loading state, and providing real-time updates through Novu events.

This file acts as a barrel file, re-exporting various UI contexts such as Appearance, Count, FocusManager, Inbox, Localization, and Novu Contexts, making them easily importable from a single location.
This file defines a Solid.js context and provider for managing UI focus, allowing components to register and unregister focus traps to control keyboard navigation within nested or modal elements.

This Solid.js context provider manages and provides access to various notification counts (unread, new, filtered) within a Novu application, updating them in real-time based on WebSocket events and Novu API calls. It offers custom hooks for components to consume these counts.

This file defines a SolidJS context (`AppearanceContext`) and provider (`AppearanceProvider`) for managing and injecting dynamic CSS styles and appearance configurations. It allows child components to consume custom variables, element styles, animations, and icons, injecting these as CSS rules into a dedicated style element in the DOM.

This file defines the `InboxContext` and `InboxProvider` for a Solid.js application, centralizing state management and functionality for an inbox or notification center UI component, including filtering, navigation, and various configuration settings.
This file defines various constants used throughout the Novu JavaScript UI, including names for inbox-related channels and websocket locks, and default values for link targets and referrers.
This SolidJS hook provides functionality to track the visibility of notifications within the UI, initializing and managing a `NotificationVisibilityTracker` instance.
This file provides a utility function to create and return a new `Notification` instance, encapsulating a raw inbox notification along with an event emitter and inbox service.
This file defines a reusable Solid.js component for rendering a bell icon. It uses an SVG graphic with a customizable linear gradient for its fill color.
This file defines a Solid.js component named `InApp` which renders an SVG icon. It represents an 'in-app' notification or message icon for the UI.
This file defines the `Unsnooze` SolidJS component, which renders an SVG icon representing an 'unsnooze' action within the UI.
This file defines a SolidJS UI component named BellCross. It renders an SVG icon depicting a bell with a cross, likely used for 'no notifications' or 'notification off' states.
This file defines and exports a SolidJS component named `MarkAsArchived` which renders an SVG icon visually representing the action of marking something as archived.
This file defines a Solid.js functional component named `BellPlus` that renders an SVG icon depicting a bell with a plus sign, suitable for use in a user interface.
This file defines a Solid.js component named `MarkAsRead` which renders an SVG icon visually representing an item marked as read, typically used for UI elements like messages or notifications.
This SolidJS component provides an SVG icon representing the 'Mark As Unarchived' action. It's likely used within the Novu UI to visually indicate an item being unarchived.
This file defines a SolidJS component named `MarkAsArchivedRead` which renders an SVG icon. This icon visually represents the action or status of marking an item as archived and read.
This file defines and exports a Solid.js functional component named `Unread`. It renders an SVG icon typically used to signify anread status or new notification.
This SolidJS component renders an SVG icon representing the 'Mark As Unread' action, typically used in UI elements like messaging or notification lists.
A Solid.js functional component that renders an SVG icon, likely representing a 'Push' action or notification icon within the UI.

This directory is designated to contain JavaScript-based UI components or related front-end code for the Novu project. As part of the `packages/js` structure, it likely encapsulates user interface functionalities or shared UI elements.
This file defines the `ThemeStore` class, which manages a collection of themes, allowing them to be added, retrieved by ID, and a default theme to be set and accessed.
This file defines TypeScript interfaces for theme configurations, including branding details and email template specifications within the Novu stateless package.

This file contains unit tests for the `inAppChannelSchemas.output` schema, validating its behavior for URL redirection, including default target values based on URL type and error handling for invalid URL or target inputs.

This file serves as an aggregation point, re-exporting various Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) related to notifications and subscriber preferences for a widget component. It simplifies imports by providing a single entry point for these DTOs within the shared package.
This file serves as an entry point to re-export modules related to notification item buttons, likely consolidating exports for easier access within the `shared` package.

This file defines interfaces for notification button configurations and styles. It exports default button configurations (primary, secondary) and theme-specific styles (dark, light) for notification item buttons.

This file defines a constant object, `FILTER_TO_LABEL`, which maps filter part type enumerations to their corresponding human-readable labels. It centralizes display names for various filter components used across the application.

This file defines a customized toast notification system using the 'sonner' library. It includes components for toast appearance, icons, close buttons, and integrates with the application's theme for consistent styling.
Defines and exports the styling variants for an 'inbox button' component using `class-variance-authority` and Tailwind CSS.

This directory is intended to store publicly accessible image assets specifically used for notifications within the Novu dashboard application. Although currently empty, it serves as the designated location for such static image files.
This file provides utility functions for manipulating HTML content. Specifically, it includes a function to remove Novu branding elements from an HTML string.

This file defines the `InAppControlsMetadataResponseDto` type, which encapsulates metadata for in-app controls, including data schema, UI schema, and control values. It also provides a Zod schema and a JSON parsing function for this DTO.
This file defines the `TextAlignEnum` for text alignment options (center, left, right) and includes its Zod schema for validation, typically generated by Speakeasy for API models.
This file defines the `InboxService` class, which provides an API client for interacting with the Novu inbox, including managing notifications, user preferences, and subscriptions.
Provides utility functions for comparing notification properties and for filtering Notification objects based on various criteria such as tags, data, read/seen status, and creation time.

This file defines the `Notification` class, which serves as an API client for managing individual inbox notifications. It provides methods for common actions like reading, archiving, snoozing, and completing primary/secondary actions on a notification, interacting with an `InboxService` and `NovuEventEmitter`.

This file defines TypeScript types for various arguments and response structures used in notification-related operations, such as listing, filtering, counting, and actions like marking as read or snoozed.

This file provides helper functions for managing notification states, including marking notifications as read, unread, seen, archived, snoozed, and completing/reverting actions on them. It handles API calls, optimistic updates, and event emission for notification lifecycle events.

This file defines the `Notifications` class, which acts as a client for managing user notifications. It provides methods to list, count, and perform various actions (e.g., read, archive, delete, snooze, complete/revert actions) on individual or bulk notifications, utilizing an `InboxService` and caching mechanisms.
This file defines JSON schemas for the output and result structures of in-app notification channels, including content, actions, redirects, and status properties like seen/read.

This file defines the `INotificationDto` interface, which specifies the data structure for a notification object used within the system. It outlines properties such as IDs, content, channel type, status, and associated entities like actors and subscribers.
This file defines enumerations and types related to message statuses (read, unread, seen, unseen) and URL redirection properties, including target attributes like '_self' or '_blank'.
This file defines default data retention periods in days for various types of notifications and messages within the application.

This file serves as an index for message-related entities, specifically re-exporting interfaces defined in `messages.interface.ts` to provide a consolidated export point for the `messages` module within the shared package.

This file defines interfaces for message-related entities, including the core IMessage interface which describes the structure of a message, along with interfaces for Call-To-Action (CTA) and message actions.
Defines the base interface for a notification entity, including its unique identifier. This interface is likely shared across different parts of the application.

This file defines the `GetInAppActivatedCommand` class, which is used to encapsulate parameters for retrieving the activation status of in-app notifications. It extends `EnvironmentCommand`, implying it operates within a specific project environment.
This file defines a use case that determines if the in-app feature is active for a given organization and environment by checking for the presence of online onboarding subscribers.
This file contains end-to-end tests for the `/v1/feeds` API endpoint, specifically verifying the retrieval of feeds and the creation of a default feed if none are present.

This file defines the API endpoints and orchestrates the business logic for managing a user's notification inbox and preferences. It handles operations like retrieving notifications, updating preferences, and managing subscriber sessions.

This NestJS module defines the core functionalities for the application's inbox feature, including controllers for inbox and topic management, and providing various repositories and use cases related to subscriptions, topics, and general inbox operations.
Defines the data transfer object (DTO) for the response when querying notification counts, including the count and associated filter for each notification category.
This file defines the Data Transfer Object (DTO) for marking notifications as seen, specifying the expected fields like notification IDs, tags, and optional data in the request body.
Defines the ActionTypeRequestDto, used for validating request data that specifies an action type, which must be a valid button type.

This file defines data transfer objects (DTOs) for handling requests to retrieve notification counts. It includes `GetNotificationsCountRequestDto` for the main request and `NotificationsFilter` for specifying various filtering criteria like tags, read status, or severity levels.
Defines the Data Transfer Object (DTO) for requesting to snooze a notification, including validation to ensure the snooze-until date is in the future.
This file defines the Data Transfer Object (DTO) for the response when retrieving inbox notifications, including the notification data, a flag for more results, and the applied filter.
This file defines the DTO for updating all notifications, including optional tags and data fields. It's used to structure and validate the request body for such an operation.

This file defines the GetNotificationsRequestDto, which is a Data Transfer Object used to specify parameters for retrieving a paginated and filtered list of notifications, including criteria like status, severity, and creation time.
Defines an enum for analytics event names specifically related to inbox functionalities, such as session initialization, notification fetching, and preference updates.

This file provides utility functions to map generic message entities into specific in-app notification DTOs for the inbox feature. It handles conversions for both single messages and arrays of messages.

This index file aggregates and re-exports utility functions primarily focused on analytics for the inbox feature. It serves as an entry point for other modules to import inbox-related analytics utilities.

This file defines TypeScript types for various entities related to an inbox feature, including subscribers, inbox notifications, notification filters, and inbox preferences. It establishes the data structures used for managing and interacting with an in-app notification inbox.
This file provides utility functions to validate the structure and content of data objects, enforcing rules like maximum nesting depth, scalar value types, and string length limits for API input.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the `/v1/inbox/notifications/{read,archive,read-archive}` API endpoints. It verifies the functionality of marking all notifications as read, archived, or read and archived, including cases using notification tags.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the `/inbox/notifications/count` API endpoint. It verifies that the API correctly returns notification counts based on various filters like tags, read status, archived status, snoozed status, and seen status.
This file contains end-to-end tests for the `/inbox/notifications` GET endpoint of the Novu API, covering functionality like validation, pagination, and filtering of notifications.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the `/v1/inbox/notifications/seen` API endpoint, verifying its functionality to mark notifications as seen based on provided IDs or filters, and handling various validation and error scenarios.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Novu API's notification deletion functionality. It covers single and bulk deletion of inbox notifications via DELETE and POST requests, including filtering by tags and data, and verifies authorization rules.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Novu API endpoint that handles updating (completing or reverting) notification actions within a user's inbox. It validates various scenarios including error handling and successful updates of primary and secondary actions.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the notification snooze and unsnooze functionalities in the Novu API. It verifies successful operations, handles error cases like invalid dates or unauthorized access, and checks filtering of snoozed notifications.
This file contains end-to-end (e2e) tests for the API endpoints related to marking inbox notifications with various statuses (e.g., read, unread, archive, snooze).

This file serves as a barrel export for all use cases and services related to the inbox feature, aggregating them into a single `USE_CASES` array. It includes operations for notification management, preferences, subscriptions, and other inbox-specific functionalities.
This file defines a no-operation (noop) use case for sending webhook messages, which serves as a placeholder that does not perform any actual action.

This file defines the `MarkManyNotificationsAsCommand` class, used to specify the data required for marking multiple inbox notifications as read, archived, or snoozed within the Novu application's API.

This file contains unit tests for the `MarkManyNotificationsAs` use case, which handles marking multiple notifications as read or archived. It verifies various scenarios, including error handling for missing subscribers and interaction with message repositories and websocket services.

This file defines a use case for marking multiple notifications as read, archived, or snoozed for a specific subscriber. It updates message statuses, invalidates caches, logs interaction traces, and dispatches webhooks and real-time updates.

This file defines the `DeleteManyNotificationsCommand` class, which specifies the data structure required to delete multiple notifications. It includes an array of notification IDs along with environment and subscriber context.

This file defines a use case for deleting multiple notifications (messages) for a specific subscriber. It handles the deletion, logs interaction traces, invalidates relevant caches, sends webhooks for deleted messages, and updates WebSocket listeners.

This file defines a use case for retrieving in-app notifications for a specific subscriber, supporting various filtering options such as read status, archiving, data fields, and time ranges. It orchestrates fetching data from the message repository and applies business logic and analytics tracking.
This file defines the `GetNotificationsCommand` class, which specifies the data structure and validation rules for parameters used to retrieve paginated and filtered notifications from an inbox.

This file contains unit tests for the `GetNotifications` use case, verifying its functionality, error handling for invalid input, and proper analytics tracking when fetching notifications for a subscriber.

This file defines a use case for deleting all notifications for a specific subscriber based on various filters. It handles data validation, message deletion, cache invalidation, analytics tracking, and sending webhook and WebSocket events related to the deletion.

This file defines the `DeleteAllNotificationsCommand`, used to encapsulate parameters for deleting multiple notifications for a specific subscriber within an environment. This Next.js page demonstrates how to integrate the Novu Inbox component, specifically showcasing the customization of the notification bell icon using a custom React component. It defines a `CustomBell` component to render a personalized bell icon with an unread count.

This file defines a Next.js page that integrates Novu components to display user notifications. It showcases custom rendering for individual notifications within the Novu Inbox, handling read/unread states, and includes a simple counter for demonstration purposes.

This file implements a Next.js page demonstrating the Novu Subscription component, showcasing how to display and manage user notification preferences for workflows and conditional rules, with a theme toggle.

This file defines a React Context and provider for managing and sharing a global 'status' state (e.g., 'all', 'unread', 'archived') across components. It includes a custom hook `useStatus` to easily access this context within a React application.
This file defines a React component named `Show`. It conditionally renders its `children` prop based on the `when` prop, displaying a `fallback` component if `when` is false.

This file defines a React component `MoreActionsDropdown` that provides a dropdown menu for Novu notification actions, including marking all as read, archiving all, and archiving all read notifications.

This file defines a reusable React component, `StatusDropdown`, which provides a UI for selecting and displaying different message or notification statuses (e.g., all, unread, archived) using a dropdown menu.

This file defines and exports a collection of reusable React functional components, each rendering a specific SVG icon like ArrowDropDown, InboxIcon, Unread, and Archive, for use in a client-side Next.js application.

This file defines the `NotionTheme` React component, which renders a notification inbox UI. It includes a sidebar for navigation and a main area displaying a dynamically loaded, scrollable list of notifications with status filtering, using Novu's notification hooks.

This file defines the `InboxItem` React component, which renders an individual notification within a user's inbox. It displays notification details, provides interactive actions like marking as read/unread or archiving, and customizes its appearance based on the notification type and status.
This file defines a `SidebarItem` React component, used to render an individual item within a navigation sidebar. It displays an icon and a label, with styling that changes when the item is active.
This file defines a client-side inbox page for a Next.js application using the app router. It integrates Novu components to display notifications, user preferences, and a custom inbox interface.

This file provides a React Query hook (`useMessagesDeleteMutation`) for deleting messages from the Novu platform. It defines the mutation variables and data types, and constructs the necessary mutation function for integration with React Query.

This file provides React Query hooks and utility functions for fetching, caching, and invalidating 'messages' data from the Novu API, specifically for listing all messages with filtering and pagination capabilities.
This file provides a React Query mutation hook for updating the state (e.g., mark as read/unread/seen/unseen) of all in-app notifications for a specific subscriber.
This file defines a React Query mutation hook for updating the 'seen' status of a subscriber's messages in the Novu API, allowing clients to mark in-app notifications as seen.

This file provides React Query integration for fetching a subscriber's notification feed from the Novu API. It includes functions for prefetching, building query options, and generating query keys for the `subscribersNotificationsFeed` API call.
This file provides React Query hooks and utility functions for fetching, managing, and invalidating cached data related to a subscriber's in-app notification feed.

This file provides React Query utilities, including a query key builder, prefetcher, and query function, specifically for fetching and caching a list of notifications via the Novu API. It is likely auto-generated by an SDK tool.
This file provides React Query hooks and utility functions for fetching, caching, and invalidating a list of notification events from the Novu API.

This file provides React Query hooks and utilities for fetching, setting, and invalidating the unseen notification count for subscribers. It allows for both standard and suspense-enabled data fetching.
This file provides React Query utilities for fetching the unseen notification count for subscribers, including functions for prefetching and building query configurations.
This file defines an enumeration (WebSocketEventEnum) for different types of WebSocket events, primarily related to notification status changes like 'received', 'unread', and 'unseen' counts.

This file contains a utility function that maps message status changes (read/unread, seen/unseen) to the appropriate WebSocket event for real-time notifications. It translates backend message status updates into events suitable for client-side consumption.

This directory is designated for defining TypeScript types, interfaces, and other type-related declarations specific to the websocket application. It ensures type safety and clarity within the websocket communication logic, even if currently empty.

This file implements a WebSocket gateway responsible for managing real-time connections, user authentication, and dispatching personalized messages and notification counts (unread/unseen) to connected subscribers based on their context.

This directory is intended to house the business logic or application-specific operations (use cases) that are exposed and handled via WebSocket connections within the 'ws' application. It would typically contain modules defining how various socket events are processed and interact with core application services.

This file manages WebSocket connections and message routing for a real-time system. It handles upgrading HTTP requests to WebSockets and delegates them to Durable Objects, and also provides an endpoint for sending messages to specific users or rooms, with support for EU region-specific jurisdiction.

This file implements an interactive notification inbox button for the Novu dashboard, integrating Novu's React components with user authentication and environment settings. It dynamically configures the inbox based on whether it's a test environment, self-hosted, or a production/staging deployment.
This file acts as a barrel file, aggregating and exporting AI-related drawer components, providers, and hooks for easier access and management within the application.
This file defines a React component, `AiDrawer`, which provides an AI chat and search interface within a slide-out drawer using the Inkeep embedded platform for the Novu application.

This component renders a preview of the Novu inbox, configuring it with user-specific data, environment details, and custom appearance settings. It allows users to visualize their Novu notifications within the dashboard.

This file defines a React component that provides a playground or configuration interface for customizing an inbox's appearance. Users can select different layout styles (popover, sidebar, full-width), toggle tabs, and choose primary and foreground colors.

This component provides an interactive playground for demonstrating the in-app notification inbox, allowing users to send a demo notification and preview the inbox content as part of an onboarding flow.
This file defines a React component named `Notification5Fill` that renders a filled notification SVG icon, used for display within the application's UI.

This file defines a React functional component `EmailFooter` that renders an SVG icon, likely representing a stylized email or document footer within a UI. It is designed to be reusable as an icon in React applications.

This file exports a React component that renders an SVG filled inbox bell icon, specifically designed with a 'dev' (developer) indicator. It allows for customization of different parts of the icon through CSS class names.

This file defines and exports a React functional component named `InboxArrowDown`. It renders an SVG icon depicting an arrow pointing down, typically used for inbox-related actions like downloading or receiving.
This file exports a React component that renders an SVG icon depicting an ellipsis (three dots). It is likely used within an 'inbox' context as indicated by its name.
This file provides helper functions for displaying consistent UI toasts using the `sonner` library, including custom success, error, and warning toast types with predefined styling and positioning.

This file implements React components for fetching, displaying, and managing a stack of animated changelog cards in the dashboard, sourced from Sanity. It allows users to view new features, dismiss cards, and tracks user interactions.

This file implements a React component that guides users through the final steps of in-app inbox setup by displaying integration instructions, providing a cURL code snippet, and actively waiting for and detecting the user's first API trigger before allowing them to complete onboarding.

This file defines the prompt and instructions for an AI agent specializing in integrating the Novu Inbox component into Angular applications. It outlines the steps, requirements, constraints, and code snippets for setting up Novu within an Angular project.

This file contains a detailed prompt for an AI agent, guiding it through the process of integrating the Novu Inbox component into React Native applications, including code snippets, best practices, and a step-by-step checklist.
Defines the available installation methods ('cli', 'manual', 'ai-assist') for the inbox framework within the welcome guide component.
This file defines a React component for the inbox embed success page. It informs the user about a successful inbox embedding process and provides a button to navigate to the main dashboard.

This file defines the Inbox Usecase page, which provides a demonstration or playground for integrating the Novu Inbox component. It handles authentication, environment loading, and displays either the interactive Inbox playground or a loading skeleton.
This file defines the InboxEmbedPage React component, which guides users through connecting and confirming their in-app inbox integration with Novu, displaying an embedded inbox widget.

This directory is intended to store publicly accessible image assets specifically related to phones or mobile devices. These images are likely used within the dashboard application for UI elements, mockups, or promotional content.

This file defines a React hook (`useInlineImageState`) that extracts and manages the state (attributes like dimensions, source, and links) of an inline image node within a Tiptap editor. It provides a convenient way to access and monitor these image properties for UI components.

This file defines a React component for a text editor's 'Turn Into Block' menu, allowing users to transform selected text blocks into different types (e.g., headings, lists) via a popover with various options and categories.
This file provides a utility function for the Tiptap editor to delete a specific type of node by finding its parent node and applying a transaction.

This file defines a Tiptap editor extension for image uploads, including configuration for allowed MIME types and integration with a ProseMirror image upload plugin. It also provides a React hook to access the image upload options from the editor instance.

This file defines a Tiptap editor plugin for handling image uploads. It supports drag-and-drop and paste events, displaying a placeholder image while the actual image is being uploaded via a provided callback.
This file defines configurations for bullet and ordered list blocks, including their titles, descriptions, icons, and commands for toggling these list types within an editor.

Subscriber & Audience Management.description: A comprehensive system for managing the user base that receives notifications. It supports creating and updating subscriber profiles, managing notification preferences, and grouping users into topics for targeted messaging.

files.description: This file serves as an entry point for the preferences module, re-exporting components related to user preferences and their scheduling.

This file defines the `Preferences` class, a core module for managing user preferences within the Novu system, including functionalities for listing, updating, and caching preferences, as well as scheduling preference-related tasks.

This file defines the `Schedule` class, which encapsulates the logic for managing and updating a user's notification schedule, including enablement status and weekly schedule details, within the Novu system.

This file defines the `Preference` class, which represents a user's notification preferences for a specific workflow, including channels, enabled status, and schedule, and provides a method to update these preferences.

This file defines TypeScript types and interfaces for managing user preferences and their associated schedules within the Novu JavaScript package, including arguments for fetching, listing, and updating preferences.

This file contains helper functions for managing user notification preferences and schedules. It provides utilities for updating individual or bulk preferences, and notification schedules, including optimistic updates, API interactions, caching, and event emission.

This file defines TypeScript types and interfaces for managing subscriptions, including argument types for CRUD operations on subscriptions and their preferences, as well as various filter configurations for workflows.

This file defines the `SubscriptionPreference` class, which represents a user's notification preference for a specific workflow. It encapsulates preference details and provides functionality to update these preferences via an API, leveraging caching.

This file defines the `DefaultSubscription` React component, which wraps the `@novu/js` `Subscription` UI component. It integrates the subscription functionality within the Novu UI context, enabling dynamic mounting and custom rendering of subscription preferences.
Defines the data transfer objects (DTOs) for updating a subscriber's notification preferences, including overall enablement and specific channel preferences.
This file serves as an index for preference-related constants within the shared package, re-exporting them from a dedicated constants file.
This file serves as an export hub for the subscriber preference interface. It re-exports the `subscriber-preference.interface` for external use within the module.
This file defines TypeScript interfaces and enums for managing subscriber notification preferences, including channel settings, overrides, and template configurations within the Novu application.

This file defines a React component called `TimezoneSelect` which provides a searchable dropdown for users to select a timezone. It integrates with `react-timezone-select` for timezone data and uses UI primitives for its interactive functionality.
This utility file defines an array of all weekdays, likely for use in scheduling or preference settings within the Novu dashboard's subscriber components.

This file defines the `PreferencesItem` React component, which displays a single user preference item for a communication channel. It shows the channel's icon, label, and a toggle switch to enable or disable it.
This component renders a blank or empty state for the user preferences section, indicating that no preferences are currently set and guiding the user to create workflows or view documentation.

This component renders the UI for managing a subscriber's notification preferences, including global channel settings, workflow-specific preferences, and optional scheduling, with support for context-based filtering.

This file defines a React component (`WorkflowPreferences`) that displays and allows users to manage their channel preferences for a specific notification workflow. It provides an expandable card showing workflow details, individual channel toggles, and an update timestamp.
This file defines a skeleton loading UI component for displaying the preferences section within the dashboard, providing a visual placeholder while data is being fetched.

This component provides a user interface for managing and displaying a subscriber's notification schedule, allowing them to enable/disable and configure their weekly availability for receiving notifications.

This file defines the `ScheduleTable` React component, which allows users to manage a subscriber's weekly notification schedule. It enables toggling individual days on or off and setting specific start and end times for each day.
This component provides a UI element that allows users to copy a specific day's schedule to other selected days of the week within a user's preferences.

This file defines a React component (`SubscriptionPreferences`) responsible for displaying and managing a subscriber's preferences for a specific topic. It shows subscription details, topic key, subscriber ID, and a list of preference rules, along with quick actions.

This React component provides a side drawer for displaying and managing a user's subscription preferences. It fetches subscription data based on provided IDs and renders the preferences within a `Sheet` component.

This component displays a single subscription preference rule for a subscriber. It shows either a simple enabled/disabled state for a workflow or an expandable view of a complex JSON condition using a CodeMirror editor.
This file defines a React hook (`useFetchSubscriberPreferences`) that fetches a subscriber's preferences using TanStack Query, leveraging authentication and environment contexts.
This file defines a React hook (`useOptimisticChannelPreferences`) for updating a subscriber's channel preferences with optimistic UI updates using React Query.

This file defines a custom React hook, `usePatchSubscriberPreferences`, which provides mutation functionality for updating a subscriber's preferences. It leverages `@tanstack/react-query` to handle the API call and invalidates relevant cache entries upon success.

This file defines a React hook `useOptimisticScheduleUpdate` for optimistically updating a subscriber's schedule preferences via the API. It leverages React Query for managing the mutation, optimistic UI updates, and error handling with rollback.
This file serves as an entry point for the preferences module, exporting its main module, PreferencesModule.

This file contains unit tests for the preference management functionalities in the Novu application. It verifies the creation, updating, and retrieval of workflow, user workflow, global subscriber, and subscriber workflow preferences.

This file defines the NestJS 'PreferencesModule', which orchestrates the components responsible for managing user preferences within the Novu API, including data access, business logic (use cases), and API endpoints.

This file defines several Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) for user notification preferences, such as workflow and channel preferences. All defined classes and their properties are marked as deprecated, indicating they represent an outdated structure that will be removed in future versions.

This file defines the `UpsertPreferencesDto` Data Transfer Object, used for updating or inserting user preferences associated with a specific workflow. Both the DTO itself and its properties are marked as deprecated, indicating it should no longer be used.

This file defines the `GetPreferencesResponseDto` Data Transfer Object, which structures the response for an API call retrieving a user's notification preferences. It includes details such as preference level, workflow, enabled status, channel settings, and optional conditions.

This file defines the `UpdatePreferencesRequestDto`, a data transfer object used to represent a request for updating user notification preferences across various channels like email, SMS, and in-app, including scheduling and conditional logic.

This file contains unit tests for the `BulkUpdatePreferences` use case, verifying its functionality for updating user preferences in bulk. It covers various scenarios including error handling, validation, and correct processing of different workflow ID types.

This file contains unit tests for the `UpdatePreferences` use case, verifying its functionality for updating subscriber preferences at both global and template levels. It tests various scenarios, including handling missing subscribers and updating preferences based on workflow IDs or identifiers.

This file defines the `UpdatePreferences` use case, which handles updating and retrieving a subscriber's notification preferences, either globally or for a specific workflow or subscription, and then triggers a webhook event.
Defines the data transfer object (DTO) for updating a subscriber's notification preferences, including channels, workflows, and conditions, within a specific environment.
Defines a Data Transfer Object (DTO) for managing a subscriber's communication channel preferences, such as email, SMS, in-app, chat, and push notifications.

This file defines the `ChannelPreference` data transfer object (DTO), which specifies the type of a notification channel and whether it is enabled. It is used for validating and documenting channel preferences in an API.
Defines the data transfer object (DTO) for the response when retrieving subscriber preferences, including details about the template and the subscriber's specific preferences.

This file defines the `SubscriberPreferenceDto` data transfer object, used to represent a subscriber's preferences for a workflow. It includes fields for overall enablement, channel-specific preferences, and optional channel overrides.
Defines the data transfer object (DTO) for representing a subscriber's preference override, specifying the channel type and the source of the override.

This file defines the DTO (Data Transfer Object) used for updating a subscriber's global notification preferences. It specifies optional fields for enabling/disabling preferences and for an array of channel-specific preferences.

This file defines the parameters (`GetSubscriberPreferencesByLevelParams`) for an API endpoint that retrieves a subscriber's preferences, allowing filtering by a specific `PreferenceLevelEnum`. It uses `class-validator` for input validation of the `subscriberId` and the preference `parameter`.

This file serves as a barrel export for subscriber-related parameters, specifically re-exporting the parameters for fetching subscriber preferences by level. It simplifies imports for other modules needing these parameter definitions.
This file serves as an index or entry point for the 'get-subscriber-global-preference' use case, re-exporting its command and use case implementations.
This file defines a use case that retrieves and processes a subscriber's global notification preferences, including active channels and default settings, for the Novu platform.

Defines the command structure for retrieving a subscriber's global notification preferences, including an option to fetch inactive channels. This command is used to initiate the use case for getting subscriber global preferences.
This file serves as an index for the 'get subscriber preference' feature, exporting both the command and its corresponding use case for retrieving subscriber preferences.

This file defines a use case for retrieving a subscriber's notification preferences. It aggregates and merges preferences from various sources (global, workflow resource, user, and subscriber-specific) and filters them based on workflow criticality.
This file defines the `GetSubscriberPreferenceCommand` class, which serves as a data transfer object (DTO) specifying the input parameters for retrieving a subscriber's notification preferences.

This file defines a use case for retrieving subscriber preferences, either globally or specifically, based on a provided level. It includes a feature flag check to determine service availability before fetching preferences.

This file defines the `GetPreferencesByLevelCommand` class, which serves as a data transfer object (DTO) for requesting a subscriber's notification preferences at a specified level, including an option to include inactive channels.
Defines the data transfer object (DTO) for retrieving a subscriber's preferences, including global and workflow-specific settings.
This file defines Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) for bulk updating subscriber preferences, including specific preferences for workflows and channels, as well as an optional context payload.

This file defines Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) for updating a subscriber's preferences, including channel-specific settings, workflow preferences, scheduling, and context payloads. It is used for patching subscriber preference data.
This file defines the Data Transfer Object (DTO) for requesting subscriber preferences. It specifies the expected query parameters, such as `criticality` and `contextKeys`, for filtering preferences.
Defines the data transfer object (DTO) for managing a subscriber's global notification preferences, including overall enablement, channel-specific settings, and an optional schedule.

This file defines the `SubscriberWorkflowPreferenceDto`, a Data Transfer Object (DTO) used to represent a subscriber's notification preferences for a specific workflow, including its enablement status, channel preferences, and any overrides.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Novu API's subscriber preferences endpoint (`/subscribers/:subscriberId/preferences`). It verifies the retrieval of subscriber preferences, including handling defaults, multiple workflows, channel inheritance, and context-specific settings.

This file contains end-to-end tests for patching and bulk updating subscriber preferences via the /subscribers/:subscriberId/preferences API endpoint in Novu v2, covering various scenarios including workflow, global, and contextual preferences, as well as error handling.

This file defines a use case that retrieves and aggregates a subscriber's global notification preferences and specific workflow notification preferences. It combines these into a single DTO for consumption.
This file defines the `GetSubscriberPreferencesCommand` class, which serves as a data transfer object for requesting a subscriber's preferences, optionally filtered by workflow criticality.
Defines the `UpdateSubscriberPreferencesCommand` class, which encapsulates the data required to update a subscriber's notification preferences, including channels, schedule, and context.

This file defines the `UpdateSubscriberPreferences` use case, responsible for updating a subscriber's notification preferences, either globally or for a specific workflow. It also handles resolving and applying preference contexts based on feature flag status.

This file defines a Data Transfer Object (DTO) for channel preferences, specifically to indicate whether notification delivery is enabled for a channel. It is used within a NestJS application, likely for API request or response validation.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the `/widget/preferences` API endpoint, verifying the retrieval of a subscriber's notification preferences under various conditions, including default settings and merged preferences.

This file contains end-to-end (e2e) tests for the API endpoint responsible for updating a subscriber's notification preferences for a specific template. It covers scenarios like updating channel-specific preferences, handling invalid updates, and overriding default template settings.
This file defines the Data Transfer Object (DTO) for requests to update a subscriber's preferences, including optional channel-specific settings and an overall enabled status for workflows.

This file defines Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) for updating a subscriber's notification preferences, including specific workflow preferences and global preferences. It includes definitions for related entities like notification triggers, variables, and template configurations for API responses.
This file serves as an index for the 'create subscription preferences' use case, exporting its associated command and use case implementation.

Defines the `CreateSubscriptionPreferencesCommand` class, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to encapsulate the necessary information for creating or updating subscription preferences, including subscriber details, topic keys, preferences, and associated workflows.

This file defines a use case for creating and managing subscription preferences for users or topics, supporting both individual and batch operations. It handles the logic for setting up workflow-specific preferences based on provided commands and existing subscriber data.
This file contains a test suite for the 'Preference Centralization Migration', which was part of an older release (v2.1.0) and has dependencies that are no longer present in the current codebase.

This file defines a migration script for centralizing workflow and subscriber preferences. It currently serves as a placeholder, instructing users to run the actual migration from a specific older version of the repository.

This migration script identifies and removes duplicate preference entries in the database across different preference types, ensuring uniqueness by keeping only the oldest record for each set of duplicates.

This file contains integration tests for a database migration script. It verifies that the migration successfully removes duplicate preference entries from the database, ensuring uniqueness by retaining the oldest record for various preference types.

This file defines a function to bulk update a subscriber's preferences by making an API call to a specific endpoint. It handles request construction, execution, and response parsing, including error handling.

This file defines a client-side function for an API call to retrieve a subscriber's channel preferences by their unique ID. It handles request serialization, API interaction, and response deserialization, including error handling.

This file defines an auto-generated SDK function for the Novu API, specifically designed to update a subscriber's preferences by their ID. It allows for updating global preferences or preferences tied to a specific workflow.

This file provides a React Query mutation hook (`useSubscribersPreferencesUpdateMutation`) for updating a subscriber's preferences in the Novu API. It encapsulates the API call and integrates with Tanstack React Query for state management.
This file provides a React Query hook (`useSubscribersPreferencesBulkUpdateMutation`) for bulk updating subscriber preferences via an API, including the necessary types and mutation function.

This file provides React Query integrations for fetching and prefetching a subscriber's preferences, including defining the query key and the asynchronous query function for the 'subscribersPreferencesList' API call.

This file provides React Query hooks and utilities for fetching, setting, and invalidating subscriber preferences data from the Novu API. It is a generated client for managing subscriber-specific preference lists.
This file defines an SDK class for managing subscriber preferences. It provides methods to retrieve, update, and bulk update subscriber preferences, including global and workflow-specific settings.
This file defines the request and response types, along with their Zod schemas and JSON serialization/deserialization functions, for the 'update subscriber preferences' operation in the API.
This file defines the request and response types, along with serialization/deserialization logic, for an API operation that marks messages for a specific subscriber.
This file defines the request and response types, along with their serialization/deserialization logic, for the bulk update subscriber preferences operation in an SDK generated by Speakeasy.

This file defines the request and response types, along with their serialization/deserialization logic, for the API operation to retrieve a subscriber's preferences. It also includes an enum for criticality filtering.

This file defines the `ChannelPreferenceDto` type, which specifies notification delivery preferences for a channel, and provides utility functions for its JSON serialization and deserialization using Zod schemas.

This file defines data transfer objects (DTOs) and their corresponding Zod schemas for bulk updating subscriber preferences, including nested types for context, within an internal SDK. It appears to be an auto-generated file for API data modeling.

This file defines the `BulkUpdateSubscriberPreferenceItemDto` type, which represents a data transfer object for an item used in bulk updating subscriber preferences. It includes channel-specific settings and a workflow identifier, along with its serialization schema and function.
Defines the GetSubscriberPreferencesDto data structure, including global and workflow-specific subscriber preferences, and provides a utility function to parse it from JSON.

This file defines the `GroupPreferenceFilterDto` data transfer object (DTO) schema, including properties for enabled status, a condition, and filter details. It also provides a serialization function to convert the DTO to a JSON string, primarily for API communication or data persistence.

This file defines the data transfer object (DTO) for retrieving user preferences, including their level, associated workflow details, and channel settings. It includes TypeScript types, Zod schemas, and JSON parsing functions for these preference structures.
This file defines the data transfer objects and Zod schemas for patching a subscriber's preferences, including channel settings, workflow ID, and scheduling information.
Defines an enumeration for `PreferenceLevelEnum` to specify if a preference applies globally or to a specific template, generated by Speakeasy for API type safety.

This file defines data transfer objects (DTOs) for managing user and workflow notification preferences. It includes TypeScript types, Zod validation schemas, and serialization functions for API requests.

This file defines the `SubscriberGlobalPreferenceDto` type, representing a subscriber's global notification preferences, including enabled status, channel preferences, and an optional schedule. It also provides Zod schemas for validation and a function to parse JSON into this DTO.

This file defines the `SubscriberPreferenceOverrideDto` data structure, including its Zod schema and a JSON parsing utility, to represent subscriber preference overrides based on channel type and source.

This file defines an enumeration (`PreferenceOverrideSourceEnum`) that specifies the possible sources from which preference overrides can originate, such as 'subscriber', 'template', or 'workflowOverride'. It is part of an internal SDK's data models and includes Zod schemas for validation.
This file defines the `SubscriberWorkflowPreferenceDto` type, representing a subscriber's preferences for a specific workflow, including its schema and a function for JSON parsing.
Defines the data model for a subscriber's communication channel preferences (e.g., email, SMS, in-app) and provides schema validation and deserialization functions for it.

This file defines the `PatchPreferenceChannelsDto` type, representing user channel preferences (e.g., email, SMS, in-app) for updates. It includes validation schemas and a JSON serialization function, handling a remap for the 'inApp' field.

This file defines data models, Zod schemas, and JSON parsing utilities for `SubscriptionPreferenceDto` and its related types (`SubscriptionPreferenceDtoData`, `SubscriptionPreferenceDtoWorkflow`) within an internal SDK.
Defines the WorkflowPreferenceDto data transfer object, including its structure, Zod schemas for validation, and functions for converting it to and from JSON.

This file defines the `SubscriberPreferencesWorkflowInfoDto` type, representing workflow information within a subscriber's preferences. It includes a Zod schema for validation and a function to parse JSON into this DTO.

This file defines the Mongoose schema for user preferences, including settings for notification channels and context-based preferences, with unique indexes and pre-save hooks to handle context key hashing.

This file defines the `PreferencesRepository` class, which handles data access and persistence operations for user preferences in the database, including finding by ID and retrieving soft-deleted preference records.

This file defines the data model (`PreferencesEntity`) for storing user and workflow preferences within the Novu application, including associated IDs and preference settings. It also defines `PreferencesDBModel` for database interactions.

This file acts as a barrel file, re-exporting the entity, repository, and schema definitions for user preferences within the data access layer. It consolidates all core components related to preferences for easier module consumption.

This file defines the `TopicSubscription` class, which represents a user's subscription to a specific topic within the Novu system. It provides methods for managing the subscription, including updating its details, modifying preferences, and deleting it, often interacting with an API and a local cache.
This file serves as the main entry point for the 'subscriptions' module, re-exporting various subscription-related classes and types from its sub-modules.

This file provides helper functions for managing user subscriptions to topics and their notification preferences. It handles API interactions, caching, and event emission for subscription-related operations.

This file defines the `Subscriptions` class, which provides an API for managing topic subscriptions for a subscriber, including operations like listing, getting, creating, updating, and deleting subscriptions, with support for caching.

This file defines a React component `SubscriptionButtonWrapper` that encapsulates the logic for subscribing and unsubscribing to a topic. It manages the subscription state and renders a `SubscriptionButton`, handling user interactions and associated API calls.

This file defines the `SubscriptionButton` Solid.js component, a UI element that allows users to subscribe or unsubscribe from a topic. It dynamically displays 'subscribe' or 'unsubscribe' text and icons, and shows a loading state based on the provided props.
This file provides a utility function to construct a unique subscription identifier based on a topic key, subscriber ID, and an optional context key.

This file exports a React hook `useRemoveSubscription` that allows components to remove a user's subscription from Novu, managing the asynchronous state (loading, success, error) of the removal process.

This file defines the `useSubscription` React hook, which manages fetching, creating, and updating a user's subscription to a Novu topic. It handles loading states, errors, and real-time updates for topic subscriptions.

This file defines a React hook `useCreateSubscription` for creating a Novu topic subscription. It manages the asynchronous operation, including loading states, errors, and provides optional success and error callbacks.

This file defines a React hook `useUpdateSubscription` that provides functionality to update a user's subscription details or status via the Novu API. It manages loading states and handles success or error callbacks during the update process.
This file serves as an index for topic-related data transfer objects (DTOs) and interfaces, re-exporting them for easier access within the application.
This file defines the `ITopicSubscriber` interface, outlining the data structure for associating a subscriber with a specific topic within an organization and environment.

This file defines Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) for topics and their subscribers. These DTOs specify the data structures used for transferring information related to topics and managing their subscribers within the application.
This file defines core type aliases for identifying and naming topics within the application, specifically `TopicId`, `TopicKey`, and `TopicName` as string types.
