Translation Management.description: Enables the creation and management of multilingual content for notifications. It supports managing translations for different locales, allowing for personalized content delivery based on user language preferences.

files.description: This file defines default localization strings for the Novu UI components, including inbox, notifications, preferences, and subscription management. It also provides a SolidJS signal for dynamically overriding or extending these localization strings.

This file establishes a SolidJS context for localization, providing a `LocalizationProvider` component to manage and merge localization data, and a `useLocalization` hook to access a translation function (`t`) and the current locale throughout the application.
This file implements a content engine using Handlebars for compiling templates and extracting variables from Handlebars content.
This file contains unit tests for the `HandlebarsContentEngine`, verifying its functionality for compiling templates with variables, loops, conditional statements, and extracting template variables.

This file defines constants and utility functions related to internationalization (i18n) and translation handling, including default locale, key delimiters, regex patterns for translation keys, and templates for missing translations.
This file serves as an entry point for locale-related utilities, re-exporting modules for locale registry, validation, and definitions.
This file defines the structure for locale data and exports an array of `Locale` objects, providing comprehensive information (country, currency, language) for various regions worldwide.

This file contains unit tests for the `TRANSLATION_KEY_SINGLE_REGEX` regular expression, ensuring it correctly identifies, extracts, and validates translation keys in various formats, including handling case-insensitivity, nesting, and whitespace.

This file defines types and an enum related to localization resources and translation handling, including types for translation keys, completion options, and autocomplete configuration. It facilitates managing and interacting with translatable content within the application.

Provides utility functions for handling translation patterns and keys within a text input or editor, including checking typing state, context, parsing, and formatting.
This file defines a CodeMirror editor plugin that highlights and manages translation keys within the editor, providing functionality to display and interact with i18n data.

This file implements a CodeMirror editor plugin responsible for detecting and displaying translation keys as interactive 'pill' widgets within the editor, complete with validation and selection functionality. It dynamically updates these visual decorations based on editor content and user interaction.

This file serves as an index for exporting translation-related utilities and components specific to the email steps within the workflow editor, including a translation extension hook and a translation pill component.

This file defines the `TranslationPill` React component, a UI element that displays a translation key, validates its existence, and allows users to interact with it to potentially edit or replace the key via a popover.

This file defines a React hook, `useTranslationForm`, which encapsulates the logic and state for a form used to edit or create translation keys. It handles key validation and the asynchronous creation of new translation entries.

This file defines a React hook (`useTranslationEditor`) that manages the state and autosaving logic for editing a translation key and its associated value. It debounces user input to automatically update translation values and keys in a backend system.

This file defines a React component, `EditTranslationPopover`, which provides a popover interface for editing a specific translation's key and value within a workflow editor. It allows users to modify translation text, manage translation keys, and view/manage all translations via an integrated drawer.

This file defines a React hook that creates a virtual anchor object, simulating a DOM element's `getBoundingClientRect` at a specified position. It is used to programmatically position UI elements like popovers or tooltips without needing a physical DOM anchor.

This file defines a React hook for creating an inline decorator extension in a text editor, enabling users to insert, manage, and visualize translation keys. It provides features like dynamic suggestions, visual 'pills' for translation keys, and the ability to create new translation entries.

This file defines a React hook, `useEditorTranslationOverlay`, that integrates and manages translation-related functionality within a CodeMirror editor. It handles translation completion, selection, overlay positioning, and various translation manipulation actions for the editor.

This file defines the `TranslationResponseDto` data transfer object, its resource type enum, and associated Zod schemas for validation, typically used for handling translation responses in an API. It is an auto-generated model.

It also provides a Zod schema for validation and a utility function for parsing this DTO from a JSON string.

This file serves as an index for the localization module, re-exporting its entity, repository, and schema definitions. It consolidates related localization components for easier import and module organization.

This file defines the `LocalizationRepository` class, which extends a base repository to handle data access operations for localization-related entities and models.

Defines the `LocalizationGroupEntity` and related types, representing a localization group for different resource types (workflow, layout) within a specific environment and organization. It outlines the structure for storing and retrieving localization group data.

This file defines the `LocalizationGroupRepository`, which provides methods for interacting with the database to manage localization group entities, including finding, creating, updating, and paginating them based on various criteria like resource type, IDs, environment, and organization.
This file serves as a barrel file, re-exporting all components related to the localization group, including its entity, repository, and schema definitions.

Workflow Studio & Orchestration.description: Provides a visual builder and a code-first SDK to design, manage, and execute complex notification workflows across multiple channels, including logic for delays, digests, and conditional routing.

files.description: This file defines and exports a SolidJS component named `NodeTree` which renders an SVG icon visually representing a node tree or hierarchical structure. It's intended for use within the UI to display this specific icon.
This file defines the `StatelessControls` class, which provides a data structure for temporary, non-persistent control values used in stateless triggering by a local studio.

Defines the `ControlValuesLevelEnum` enum, which categorizes different levels of control values like workflow, step, and layout controls. This enum is likely used for managing or differentiating controls within the Novu application.

This file defines enums and interfaces for constructing and evaluating complex filters and conditions, including field operators, logical operators, and various filter part types like subscriber, payload, webhook, and real-time online status filters.
This file serves as an index for Handlebar-related utilities and defines a list of reserved variable names used within the Novu application's templating system.

This file defines a `DevServer` class that creates an HTTP server to host the Novu Studio interface locally. It handles routing for a well-known path and the studio, embedding a dynamic iframe that connects to a local or cloud-based Novu Studio instance.

This file defines API client functions for fetching and previewing individual steps within workflows in the Novu dashboard. It provides methods to retrieve a step's details and generate a preview based on provided data.

This file defines the `EmailEditorSelect` component, which allows users to switch between a block-based email editor and an HTML code editor. It includes confirmation modals to prevent data loss when changing editor types.

This file defines the `WorkflowStep` React component, which renders a visual step in a workflow based on a `StepTypeEnum`. It dynamically selects the step's variant and icon according to the provided step type.

This file defines a React component (`WorkflowIssuesPopover`) that displays a popover detailing issues found within various steps of a workflow, including a summary and individual issue listings for each affected step.

This file defines the `StepPreview` React component, which renders different notification channel content previews (e.g., email, in-app, SMS, chat, push) based on the provided step type and control values.

This file defines the `EditorOverlays` component, which renders contextual overlay elements for an editor, including a popover for editing translations and a drawer for displaying workflow payload schemas.

This file defines a React component (`HtmlEditor`) that provides an enhanced HTML editor with Liquid templating capabilities. It features syntax highlighting for HTML and Liquid, code formatting, and advanced autocomplete for Liquid variables.

This React component provides a dropdown menu for configuring in-app actions, such as primary and secondary buttons. It allows users to define button labels and redirect URLs, integrating with a form management system and a workflow editor for variable parsing.

This file defines a React hook (`useWorkflowEditorCommands`) that generates context-aware commands for the workflow editor, enabling users to trigger the current workflow, edit its preferences, and navigate to individual step configurations.

This file defines a React hook that determines if the current page is a workflow editor and fetches the corresponding workflow data if applicable. It provides context about the workflow being edited, including its data and loading status.

This file defines the `CombinatorSelector` component, a UI element used within a conditions editor to select logical combinators (e.g., AND/OR) for building queries or rules, leveraging `react-querybuilder`.

This component renders a button to add a new group of conditions within a conditions editor, likely used with `react-querybuilder`, with specific display logic based on the current level or number of rules.

This file defines the `VariableSelect` React component, which provides a searchable dropdown for selecting variables. It includes features like filtering options, keyboard navigation, and an empty state when no variables are available.

This file defines the `ConditionsEditor` React component, which provides a user interface for building and managing complex conditional logic using a query builder. It allows users to create and edit rule groups and individual conditions based on provided fields and variables.

This file defines the `OperatorSelector` React component, which provides a dropdown for selecting operators within a condition builder UI, leveraging `react-querybuilder` for its props and `React.memo` for optimization.

This component defines the dropdown actions (duplicate, delete) for individual rules or rule groups within a conditions editor UI. It integrates with `react-querybuilder` and a local context for managing condition logic.

This file defines a React context and provider for managing and manipulating rules and rule groups within a query builder, offering functionalities like adding, removing, cloning, and finding parent groups.

This file defines a mapping of data types (e.g., string, number, date) to their corresponding available operators for use in a condition editor or query builder. It also provides utility functions for retrieving operators and identifying relative date operators.
This component renders an 'Add Condition' button for a query builder interface, integrating with `react-querybuilder`. It allows users to add new rules, with a built-in limit of 10 conditions.

This file defines TypeScript types and interfaces for components used within a conditions editor, specifically for managing rules, rule groups, and variables, likely in conjunction with the 'react-querybuilder' library.

This component renders an icon (either an error warning or information icon) that, when hovered over, displays a card with detailed information, including error messages, helpful tips, and usage examples.

This file provides a utility function, `toSelectOptions`, that transforms `react-querybuilder` option lists into structured JSX elements using Novu's custom `Select` components. It handles both grouped and flat option arrays, allowing for label capitalization.

This file defines a React component (`ValueEditor`) used within a conditions or query builder to render various types of input editors (e.g., single value, range, relative date) based on the operator and field, integrating with `react-hook-form` and `react-querybuilder`.

This file defines the `FieldSelector` React component, designed for use within a conditions editor. It provides a specialized dropdown to select a field, integrating with `react-hook-form` for validation and `react-querybuilder` for its properties.

This file contains utility functions for a UI conditions editor, providing logic to determine appropriate value editor types, input placeholders, and help text based on field data types and operators.
This file defines a React functional component for the 'Digest Variable' icon, rendering it as an SVG with a linear gradient fill.
This file defines a React component that renders an SVG icon representing a stacked email footer logo with text, suitable for use in an email signature or footer.
This file exports a React functional component that renders an SVG icon for an email header, featuring a centered logo and a border. It's designed for use within the Novu dashboard application.
This file defines a React component that renders an SVG icon representing a plain text email footer. It is used to display a visual cue related to plain text content within email templates.

This file defines a React component named `EmailFooterLogoTextAndSocials` that renders an SVG icon. This icon likely represents a combination of a logo, text, and social media symbols, intended for use in an email footer.

This React component renders an SVG icon representing a paragraph with an image placeholder, likely for UI elements related to rich text editing or content blocks. It defines the SVG path and shapes for the icon.

This file defines a React functional component named `RepeatVariable` that renders a specific SVG icon. It is likely used within the dashboard application to display a repeat or variable-related symbol.
This file defines a React component that renders an SVG illustration. It visually represents a workflow trigger associated with an inbox, likely for use within the Novu dashboard.
This file defines constants related to JSON schema editing, including available schema types and a maximum nesting depth limit. It provides options for type selection in a schema editor UI.
This file serves as the main entry point for the `schema-editor` component, re-exporting its core component, associated constants, and JSON schema types.

This file defines a React component, `SchemaPropertySettingsPopover`, which provides a popover UI for editing the settings of a JSON schema property, including its name, default value, required status, and deletion, with checks for variable usage.

This file defines the `SchemaPropertyRow` React component, which renders a single editable row for a property within a JSON schema editor. It allows users to configure property name, type, and required status, and conditionally renders nested sections for complex types like objects, arrays, and enums.

This React component provides a UI for editing a data schema, allowing users to add and manage individual properties. It integrates with react-hook-form and displays information about whether schema properties are used within an associated workflow.
This file serves as an aggregation point, re-exporting all types defined within the 'schema-form.types' module, likely for the schema editor component.
This file defines a React component named `PropertyActions` that provides interactive buttons for managing a schema property, including opening a settings popover and deleting the property.
This component provides a section within a schema editor for managing a list of enum choices. It allows users to add, edit, and remove individual enum values using React Hook Form.

This React component, `PropertyNameInput`, provides a specialized input field for defining property names within a schema editor. It integrates with `react-hook-form` for form management and displays validation errors using a tooltip.

This file defines a React component (`PropertyTypeSelector`) that provides a dropdown to select and change the data type of a JSON schema property. It integrates with `react-hook-form` to manage the schema definition's type transformation based on user selection.

This file defines a React hook `useSchemaPropertyType` which determines the effective display type of a JSON schema definition for UI rendering purposes, prioritizing 'enum' if present and handling type arrays to extract the non-null type.

This file defines a React hook that generates standardized property paths for schema editor form fields. It constructs paths like `definition`, `keyName`, and `isRequired` by appending them to a given `pathPrefix`, facilitating consistent form field naming within a schema editor.

This file provides utility functions to detect and summarize changes between two JSON schemas, identifying added, deleted, type-changed, or required-status-changed properties, and tracking if those changes affect used variables.

This file provides UI helper functions, specifically calculating Tailwind CSS margin classes for dynamic indentation based on a given level.

This file provides utility functions to check if a specific variable is used within the controls or content of workflow steps. It extracts variables from various formats, including liquid templates and Maily JSON structures, to determine their usage across steps.

Provides utility functions for creating, transforming, and manipulating JSON Schema objects, focusing on converting schemas to specific types (e.g., object, array, string) while preserving relevant properties.

This file provides utility functions for managing and manipulating properties within a structured list, primarily for building and navigating JSON Schema-like definitions. It includes functions for parsing property paths, creating new properties, finding or creating nested property structures, and converting properties to object types.
Defines an enum `VariableFrom` used to categorize the origin or context of variables within the Maily component, such as from bubble menus, repeat blocks, or button components.

This file defines the `Maily` React component, which wraps the `@novu/maily-core` editor. It integrates variable pill support, translation capabilities, and custom extensions to provide a tailored email editing experience within the dashboard.
This file provides utility functions for validating and checking the emptiness of Maily-specific JSON structures, ensuring they conform to expected formats and content requirements.
This React component provides a dynamic description or hint for using iterable variables within repeat blocks in an editor, animating examples of property access when the cursor is on an empty line.

This file defines a React component `BlockCustomPreview` which renders an image along with a descriptive text. It is used to display a custom preview block, likely for email templates or similar content.

It includes details like title, description, icon, preview, and the command to insert the block, along with telemetry tracking.

Defines a 'Digest' block for an email editor, which allows displaying a list of aggregated notifications (digested events) within an email template. This block integrates with the Novu Maily core block system and includes telemetry tracking for its usage.

It manages the dynamic display and updating of these variable pills as the user types or the document changes.

This React component provides a tooltip for displaying validation errors or schema-related issues associated with a variable. It shows specific error messages when a variable is hovered, based on provided issues or an 'isNotInSchema' flag.

This file defines React components for displaying a preview of a variable, including its content and a description, within the dashboard application. It provides a structured UI element for variable visualization.

This React component asynchronously processes a given value through a set of filters and displays the resulting preview. It's used to show the outcome of applying filters, potentially formatting JSON-like results.
This file defines a React component that provides a preview for a digest sentence summary, typically displaying a notification-like message within a variable preview context.

This file defines the `VariableIcon` React component, which displays a specific icon based on the type, context, or error status of a given variable name. It provides visual cues for different kinds of variables such as translation, digest, or repetition block variables, as well as error states.

This file defines the `DigestCountSummaryPreview` React component, which visually represents a summary of a digest count, typically for unread notifications, within a variable preview UI. It provides a preview of how a digest count would appear, summarizing based on event counts.

This component represents a single reorderable filter item within a list, allowing users to configure its parameters (like variables or input values) and remove it. It handles drag-and-drop reordering and displays filter-specific details and configuration options.

This file provides a React hook `useVariableParser` and related utility functions for parsing LiquidJS-like template variables, extracting their name, default value, and applied filters from a given string.

This React hook provides functionality to create and manage dynamic variables (payload, subscriber, context) within a workflow editor. It handles updating the workflow's schema and preview context based on the type of variable being created.

This file provides a React hook (`useVariableValidation`) for validating variable names, particularly for 'payload' variables, against a schema and a set of allowed variables. It determines if a variable is valid, in schema, and generates appropriate error messages.

This file defines a utility function to apply a series of Liquid template filters to a given input value. It parses the input, constructs a Liquid template string based on provided filter parameters, and then renders it using a Liquid engine.

This file provides a centralized utility function (`getVariableErrorMessage`) to generate consistent error messages for invalid variables within editor contexts. It checks for issues like missing schema definitions, incorrect namespace usage, or disallowed variables.

This file defines and manages 'digest' variables for a templating engine, providing their metadata, display labels, preview components, and functions to generate their string representations with appropriate filters for an editor's autocompletion and information panels.

This file provides utility functions for displaying different types of toast notifications (saving, success, error) related to data saving operations within the application. It includes logic for extracting user-friendly error messages.

This file defines the `ChannelPreferences` component, which fetches workflow and environment data. It determines if the channel preferences form should be read-only based on the workflow's origin and the current environment type, then renders the `ChannelPreferencesForm` with the appropriate props.

This file defines a React component for a confirmation modal that displays detected schema changes within a workflow editor. It categorizes changes (deleted, added, type changed, required changed) and highlights if they impact existing workflow steps, allowing the user to confirm or cancel the changes.

This file defines a React context (`CanvasContext`) and a custom hook (`useCanvasContext`) to manage global state and functions related to drag-and-drop operations and node interactions within a workflow editor canvas.

This file defines React components for displaying a summary badge of workflow step conditions. It visualizes the first condition's field and the count of additional conditions, allowing users to navigate to an editor to manage the full set of conditions.

This file defines the `EditorBreadcrumbs` component, which renders navigation breadcrumbs for the workflow editor. It displays the current environment, workflow, and optionally the currently edited step, along with back navigation and saving status indicators.
Defines the foundational components and styling for a draggable and interactive node within a workflow editor, including sub-components for display, error handling, and preview functionality.

This React component (`AddStepMenu`) provides a popover menu for adding various step types (e.g., email, in-app, delay) to a workflow in the dashboard editor. It categorizes steps into 'Channels' and 'Actions', with some options being feature-flagged.

This file defines a React component that allows users to configure and manage channel and severity preferences for a specific workflow, including options to override default settings and handle individual channel toggles.

This file defines custom edge components for a workflow editor, including `AddNodeEdge` for interactive placement of new workflow steps and `DefaultEdge` for standard connections between nodes in a React Flow diagram.

This file defines a collection of React components used to construct and display an interactive preview of an in-app notification, likely within a workflow editor. It includes components for the notification's bell icon, header, avatar, content, subject, body, and action buttons.

This file defines the `WorkflowNodeActionBar` React component, which provides interactive action buttons (edit, copy, delete) for a specific node within a workflow editor, appearing contextually with animations.

This React component provides a form for configuring an individual workflow in the Novu dashboard. It allows users to edit workflow details, manage its active state, payload schema, and translation settings, and perform actions like duplication or deletion.

This React component renders a selectable item for different notification severity levels, including a tooltip that provides detailed information, an image, and a colored badge corresponding to each severity level.

This file defines and renders the visual components and interaction logic for various types of nodes (e.g., trigger, email, SMS) used within a workflow editor or canvas. It integrates with `@xyflow/react` to create interactive workflow steps.

This file defines a `URLInput` React component used within a workflow editor. It provides a combined input for a URL (supporting variable insertion) and a dropdown for selecting its target, integrated with `react-hook-form`.

It handles user interactions, drag-and-drop functionality, and displays read-only overlays based on user permissions and environment type.

This file defines a React hook `useCanvasNodesEdges` that manages the state and logic for nodes and edges within a workflow editor canvas, enabling operations like adding, inserting, copying, and removing workflow steps.

This component displays the saving status of an operation, showing a loading indicator while saving, then a 'Changes saved' badge followed by a checkmark upon successful completion, or hiding immediately if an error occurs.

This file defines a React context provider (`WorkflowProvider`) responsible for managing the state and actions related to a workflow in the application. It handles fetching, updating, and patching workflow data, as well as managing navigation blocking during ongoing save operations.

This file defines the `PayloadSchemaDrawer` React component, which provides a UI drawer within the workflow editor for managing, editing, and importing the payload schema associated with a specific workflow.

This file defines the `WorkflowTabs` component, which provides a tabbed interface for managing and interacting with a specific workflow. It includes tabs for editing the workflow canvas, viewing workflow activity, and offering integration instructions with options to copy cURL commands or Postman collections, and to trigger the workflow for testing.
This file serves as the public interface for the 'control-input' component, re-exporting its main module to facilitate easier imports within the application.

This component provides a specialized input field, `ControlInput`, for editing text that supports variables and translations within a workflow or template context. It integrates a variable editor with schema validation and translation management features.

This file defines TypeScript types, specifically `StepEditorProps`, used for props passed to components that edit individual steps within a workflow in the Novu dashboard application.

This file defines a React context (`PreviewTriggerContext`) and a custom hook (`usePreviewTrigger`) to manage and provide a `triggerPreview` function. It enables child components to trigger a preview action, with a safe fallback if the context is not available.
This file establishes a React context and a custom hook to provide form saving functionality across components within the workflow editor, enabling them to trigger a save operation.

This file defines a React component (`StepEditorUnavailable`) that informs users the step editor is only available in development environments. It prompts and provides an option to switch to a development environment if one exists.

This file defines a React component (`SdkBanner`) that displays an informational banner within the Novu dashboard's workflow editor. It informs users that step configuration is currently only available via Novu's SDKs and provides a link to the SDK documentation.

This file defines the `ConfigureStep` React component, which acts as a wrapper to fetch workflow, step, and environment data. It then renders the `ConfigureStepForm` component, passing down the retrieved data for configuring a specific workflow step.

This file defines the `StepSkeleton` component, which displays a loading (skeleton) state for a workflow step editor. It dynamically renders different skeleton layouts based on the `stepType` for various notification channels.
This component renders tabbed content for 'other' types of steps within a workflow editor, primarily displaying custom step controls in an editor tab.

This file defines constant arrays for time unit options, both general and throttle-specific, used within the Novu dashboard's workflow editor. These options provide display labels and corresponding enum values for selecting time units like seconds, minutes, hours, days, weeks, and months.

This React component renders a button for navigating to a workflow step's skip conditions editor. It displays the current number of defined skip conditions and is only active if the step supports editable conditions.

This file defines the `TabsSection` React component, which provides a styled container for content typically found within a tabbed interface. It serves as a reusable wrapper with default flexbox styling for layout within a workflow editor.

This file defines the `ConfigureStepForm` component, which provides a user interface for editing and configuring individual steps within a workflow editor, including form handling, validation, autosaving, and rendering step-specific controls and previews.

This file defines a React hook (`useEditorPreview`) that manages the preview functionality for a step within a workflow editor. It handles debouncing user input, fetching real-time preview data from an API, and synchronizing an editor's payload with server-side examples.

This React component defines a "Preview Context Panel" used within a workflow editor. It allows users to view and interact with various aspects of a workflow's execution context, including payload, subscriber data, step results, and general context, with support for data persistence and schema management.

This file defines the `StepDrawer` React component, which acts as a dynamic sidebar or drawer for displaying and managing individual steps within a workflow editor. It handles navigation, escape key closure, and adjusts its width based on the step's type.

This component provides a form for editing and managing conditions for a step within a workflow, using React Query Builder for constructing rules, Zod for validation, and React Hook Form for form management and autosaving.

This file defines a React component responsible for displaying and managing the editing interface for step conditions within a workflow editor. It renders a form to modify conditions or a skeleton loader, enclosed in a drawer.

This component manages the display of chat-related workflow steps, providing both an editor interface and a preview pane. It dynamically renders the appropriate editor based on the step's origin (Novu Cloud or external) and integrates with a preview system to show real-time changes.

This file defines the WorkflowsPage component, which displays a list of workflows, provides filtering and search functionalities, and offers quick-start options with workflow templates. It manages workflow data fetching, user interactions, and navigation related to workflows in the application dashboard.

This file defines a React hook `useDeleteContext` for asynchronously deleting a context via an API call. It handles cache invalidation and removal for the deleted context and related lists using `@tanstack/react-query`.

This file defines a React hook (`useDuplicateWorkflow`) that handles the logic for duplicating an existing workflow, including API calls, cache invalidation, and navigation to the new workflow's edit page.

This file defines a React hook (`useCreateWorkflow`) for creating new workflows. It handles the API call, navigation, toast notifications, query invalidation, and applies default layouts to email steps if necessary during workflow creation.

This file defines a React Query custom hook, `useDeleteWorkflow`, which handles the asynchronous deletion of a workflow. It leverages `useMutation` to call the `deleteWorkflow` API and invalidates relevant cache entries upon successful deletion.
This file defines a React hook (`useFetchWorkflowTestData`) that fetches workflow test data using React Query, based on a given workflow slug and the current environment.

This file defines a React hook (`useInitDemoWorkflow`) responsible for conditionally creating an 'Onboarding Demo Workflow' in Novu for a given environment if it doesn't already exist, ensuring it's only created once per environment.
This file defines a React hook, `useFetchWorkflow`, which fetches a specific workflow's data by its slug using `@tanstack/react-query`.
This file defines a custom React hook, `useFetchWorkflows`, responsible for fetching and managing paginated workflow data from the API, based on various filters and the current environment.
This file defines a React hook that checks if a payload schema is enabled for the current workflow. It returns true if a payload schema exists and the workflow's origin is Novu Cloud.

This file defines a React hook `useSyncWorkflow` responsible for synchronizing a Novu workflow to different environments. It handles the synchronization logic, including conflict resolution via a confirmation modal, and provides user feedback through toast notifications.

This file defines a React hook, `useTriggerWorkflow`, which provides functionality to trigger a workflow via an API call, handling asynchronous states like loading, success, and error using TanStack Query.

This file defines a React hook (`useUpdateWorkflow`) for updating a workflow through an API call. It handles the mutation process, including cache invalidation and updating related workflow data after a successful update.

This React hook processes environment difference data, separating workflows and layouts and mapping their dependencies. It provides a function to calculate and manage the selection state of these resources, automatically handling blocking dependencies.

This file defines a React hook (`usePatchWorkflow`) for updating an existing workflow using `react-query`. It handles API calls, integrates with the current environment, and manages cache invalidation for relevant workflow data upon successful updates.

This file defines a use case for retrieving a complete workflow run, including its step runs and execution details, from the database. It aggregates data from multiple repositories, performs data mapping, and includes backward compatibility for digest information.
Defines the data transfer object (DTO) for the paginated list of contexts, extending a cursor-paginated response with individual context details.
This file defines a use case for listing and paginating context entities, supporting filtering by type, ID, or a search term, and implementing cursor-based pagination.

This file provides a React Query hook (`useWorkflowsDuplicateMutation`) for duplicating a workflow, leveraging an internal SDK client. It defines the mutation's variables, data, and key for managing the workflow duplication API call within a React application.
This file provides React Query integrations for fetching and prefetching a list of workflows, including functions to build the query and generate a unique query key.

This file provides React Query integration for fetching workflow data, including functions to build query objects, define query keys, and prefetch workflow information using the `workflowsGet` API call.
This file defines the data transfer object (DTO) and Zod schemas for the response when retrieving workflow runs, including pagination details like next and previous cursors.

This file defines the `GetWorkflowRunsDto` type and its associated Zod schema for data validation, representing the structure of a workflow run. It also includes definitions for related enum types such as `GetWorkflowRunsDtoStatus`, `DeliveryLifecycleStatus`, and `Severity`, along with a function to parse JSON into this DTO.

User, Team & Tenant Management.description: Handles user authentication, organization and team member administration, and role-based access control. Provides multi-tenancy support for segmenting data and configurations for different customers.

files.description: This file acts as an aggregation point, re-exporting all session-related Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) defined within the `session` directory.
This file defines data transfer objects (DTOs) for session management and subscriber JSON Web Tokens (JWTs), including subscriber profile details and session token structure.
This file defines enumerations and types related to user authentication, session data, API authorization schemes, and fine-grained permissions for roles within the Novu application.
This file serves as an index for password-related utilities and constants, exporting an enum for password reset flows and helper functions.
This file defines the constraints and regular expression pattern for validating user passwords within the application, including minimum length, maximum length, and required character types.
Defines an enum to categorize the different flows or contexts in which a password reset can be initiated, such as 'forgot password' or 'user profile' initiated resets.

This file defines NestJS custom parameter decorators (`UserSession`, `SubscriberSession`) for extracting user or subscriber session information from incoming requests. It supports both HTTP and GraphQL contexts and decodes JWT tokens from the Authorization header if session data is not already available.

This file defines a `UserService` class responsible for creating, linking, and managing user accounts across Clerk (authentication) and Novu (application-specific) systems. It serves as a utility for user management, likely for testing purposes given its location.
This file defines Playwright test fixtures, primarily a `session` fixture, to set up authenticated user contexts with JWTs, organization, and environment data for testing purposes.

This file defines a `Session` class used for setting up and tearing down a complete testing environment, including users, organizations, and integrations, for Playwright e2e tests. It automates the creation and cleanup of test data across Clerk and Novu's backend services.
This file initializes and configures the Clerk authentication provider for the application, handling routing, UI customization, and localization settings.

This file defines the primary Clerk authentication provider component for the application. It provides conditional rendering and extensive customization of Clerk's UI appearance, localization, and router integration based on environment configurations.
This file exports a custom hook, `useAuth`, which provides a convenient way to access the authentication context within the Novu dashboard application.
Defines TypeScript types for the authentication context, encompassing user and organization state, including loading status and entity data.
This file creates and exports the `AuthContext` using React's Context API, serving as the central context for authentication-related data throughout the application.
This file contains utility functions responsible for mapping data structures from Clerk (authentication service) user and organization resources to Novu-specific user and organization entities.

This file defines a React AuthProvider component that integrates with Clerk for user and organization authentication. It manages user and organization data, handles redirection logic for new users or invitation acceptance, and provides authentication state and user/organization details via an AuthContext.

This file defines the `AuthSideBanner` React component, which renders a dynamic side banner for authentication pages. The banner content, including welcome messages, feature lists, and upgrade prompts, adapts based on whether the application is self-hosted or an enterprise version.

This component displays a list of 'trusted by' company logos, dynamically loading SVG images for each company from the `/images/auth/` directory. It's likely used in authentication-related pages to build trust with users.

Defines a reusable React component, `AuthCard`, that serves as a styled container for authentication-related content. It provides a consistent visual wrapper for auth forms or pages within the dashboard.

This file defines a React component, `AuthFeatureRow`, which displays a single feature with an icon, title, and description. It is likely used within authentication-related sections of the dashboard to highlight key features.
This file provides a utility function to asynchronously retrieve an authentication token, likely from the Clerk authentication service, to be used throughout the application.
This file defines the custom appearance (styling) for Clerk's authentication user interface components, specifically for sign-up and sign-in forms.
This file initializes and configures a client for the application's authentication system, handling SSO, organization-specific authentication, and token management via local storage.

This file implements a custom React context and provider (`ClerkProvider`) for managing user authentication, sessions, organizations, roles, and permissions. It exposes several hooks (e.g., `useAuth`, `useUser`, `useOrganization`) and components for handling authentication flows within the application.

This file defines a React component for the 'Forgot Password' functionality, allowing users to request a password reset link to be sent to their email. It handles email input, submission, displays loading and error states, and confirms when a reset email has been sent.

This file defines a React component for email verification, allowing users to resend verification emails and navigate back to the sign-in page. It retrieves the email address from URL parameters and displays messages regarding the verification status.
This file defines a React component for the 'Reset Password' page, allowing users to set a new password using a token obtained from the URL.

This file defines a React component for Single Sign-On (SSO) login, allowing users to initiate the SSO process by entering their work email. It handles the UI, form submission, and interaction with an authentication client for SSO.

This file serves as an aggregation point, re-exporting various UI components related to authentication, user management, and organization administration within the dashboard application. It simplifies imports for a suite of `better-auth` components.
This file defines a React component for user sign-up, handling form input, password validation, authentication calls, and redirects after successful registration or in case of errors.

This file defines the `SignIn` React component, which provides the user interface and logic for signing in with email and password. It handles form submission, authentication requests, error display, email verification resending, and navigation upon successful or failed authentication.

This file defines a `UserButton` React component that displays user information (avatar, name, email) and provides a dropdown menu with a logout option, integrating with authentication and user context hooks.
This file provides utility functions for managing JSON Web Tokens (JWTs) in self-hosted environments, including storing them in local storage and validating their expiration.
Defines the `SelfHostedUser` interface and provides a utility function, `createUserFromJwt`, to construct a `SelfHostedUser` object from a decoded JWT payload.

This file establishes a React context for authentication, decoding and validating JWT tokens to provide current user information throughout the application. It includes a provider component and a custom hook for accessing authentication state.
This file establishes a React Context for managing and providing self-hosted user information throughout the application. It decodes a JWT from local storage to create and provide the user object.
This utility file provides a function `withJwtValidation` designed to wrap API requests. It is intended to ensure a valid JWT token is present before an API call is made.
This file contains React components for user authentication, including sign-in and sign-up forms, which handle API calls to a self-hosted backend and manage user sessions.

This file implements a self-hosted authentication and user/organization management system for the Novu dashboard. It provides custom contexts, components, and hooks that mimic the interface of Clerk.js, adapted for a self-hosted environment using JWTs.

This file defines the React component for the reset password page. It conditionally redirects to the sign-in page if Clerk is the authentication provider, otherwise it renders the reset password form and associated UI elements.
This file is a React component that immediately redirects the user to the legacy studio authentication page, passing along existing URL parameters and adding a specific hint for the studio path.

This React page component allows users to view and manage API keys, application identifiers, and API/WebSocket URLs for a specific Novu environment. It includes functionality for regenerating API keys and handles displaying sensitive information securely.
This file defines the Forgot Password page component, displaying the UI for users to reset their password and handling a redirect if an enterprise authentication provider is in use.
This file defines the SSO (Single Sign-On) sign-in page component, displaying an SSO login form and redirecting if Clerk is the configured authentication provider.

This file defines the `VerifyEmailPage` component, which is responsible for displaying the email verification interface in the dashboard application. It conditionally redirects users if Clerk is the configured authentication provider.
This file defines the sign-in page component, handling user authentication through Clerk, tracking page views, and redirecting authenticated users to the main application.

This file defines the sign-up page for the application, utilizing the Clerk authentication library to render the sign-up form. It includes UI components like an authentication side banner, a region picker, and tracks sign-up page views via telemetry.
This file provides React hooks for fetching and regenerating API keys for the current environment using Tanstack Query.

This directory is designated to store image assets specifically used for authentication-related pages or components within the Novu dashboard application. Its purpose is to house graphics pertinent to user login, registration, or password management.
This file dynamically loads and configures the 'Enterprise Edition' (EE) authentication module for a NestJS application, integrating its components with local authentication services and middleware.
This file defines the API endpoints and logic for user authentication, registration, password management, and organization switching, including OAuth integrations.

This file defines the NestJS module configuration for community-based authentication, including various Passport strategies (JWT, API Key, GitHub), community-specific repository injections, and middleware for OAuth.
This file defines a global NestJS authentication module that dynamically loads its configuration and middleware based on whether enterprise-level features like Clerk or 'better auth' are enabled.
Defines the Data Transfer Object (DTO) for user registration, specifying the required fields and validation rules for creating a new user account.

This file defines Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) for handling password reset operations within the application's authentication module. It includes DTOs for the password reset request body (email) and the password reset body (new password and token), complete with validation rules.
This file defines the Data Transfer Object (DTO) for the login request body, specifying the expected structure and validation rules for email and password fields.
Defines the Data Transfer Object (DTO) for updating a user's password, including validation rules for the new password.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the user login functionality of the authentication API, covering scenarios such as successful login, incorrect credentials, failed login attempts, account blocking, and OAuth-specific login behaviors.
This file contains end-to-end tests for the `/auth/organizations/:id/switch` API endpoint. It verifies the functionality of switching a user's active organization within the system.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the `LinkEntitiesService`, which is responsible for linking external user and organization entities (e.g., from Clerk) with their corresponding internal Novu entities.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the user registration API endpoint (`/auth/register`) in the Novu application. It covers various scenarios such as validation errors, disabled registration, successful user creation, and user creation with an associated organization.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the user password update functionality of the Novu API, covering successful updates and various failure scenarios such as invalid current password, mismatched new passwords, and password policy violations.

This file contains unit tests for the `ClerkStrategy` in a NestJS application. It verifies that the strategy correctly validates Clerk JWT payloads, links internal and external entities, and handles environment access, including error cases.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the UserAuthGuard, verifying its behavior with various authentication schemes like API Key and Bearer tokens. It tests scenarios including missing/invalid credentials, different authentication types, and access control to API routes, asserting appropriate HTTP responses.
This file contains end-to-end tests for the password reset functionality of the Novu API. It validates the request, reset, and rate-limiting aspects of the /auth/reset endpoint.

This file serves as an index or collection point for various authentication and organization-related use cases within the Novu API application. It exports an array of these use cases, making them easily discoverable and injectable.
This file defines a use case for switching a user's active organization, ensuring the user is authorized for the new organization and generating a new authentication token.

This file defines the `SwitchOrganizationCommand`, a data transfer object used to initiate an authenticated request for a user to switch their active organization to a new one identified by `newOrganizationId`.

This file defines the `Login` use case, responsible for authenticating users by email and password, handling failed login attempts with account blocking, and generating an authentication token upon successful login.

This file defines the `LoginCommand` class, a data transfer object used to encapsulate the input (email and password) required for a user login operation. It includes validation rules to ensure the provided data is valid.
This file defines the `UpdatePassword` use case, responsible for updating a user's password after validating the current password and new password against the user's record.
Defines the `UpdatePasswordCommand` class, a Data Transfer Object (DTO) used for encapsulating the data required to update a user's password, including validation rules for password complexity.

This file defines the `UserRegisterCommand` class, used to encapsulate data and validation rules for a new user registration request within the application's command-query separation (CQS) architecture.

This file defines the `UserRegister` use case, responsible for handling new user registrations, including creating user accounts, hashing passwords, optionally creating an organization, and tracking registration events.

This file defines the `PasswordResetRequestCommand`, a data structure used to encapsulate the necessary information (email and optional source) for initiating a password reset request within the application's authentication flow.
This file implements the use case for initiating a password reset request, including email normalization, token generation, rate limiting, and updating user records.
Defines the `PasswordResetCommand` class, which specifies the data structure and validation rules for a password reset operation, including the new password and a reset token.
This file defines the use case for resetting a user's password, including token validation, password hashing, updating user data, and generating a new authentication token.

This file defines a NestJS authentication guard (`CommunityUserAuthGuard`) responsible for handling user authentication based on JWT or API key strategies, determining the appropriate strategy from the request's authorization header.

This file defines a `RequireAuthentication` decorator function that conditionally applies authentication guards and Swagger API bearer auth based on whether enterprise edition (EE) authentication is enabled. It centralizes the logic for applying appropriate authentication mechanisms across the application.

This file defines an AuthService class that acts as a proxy or facade, delegating all authentication-related operations to an injected IAuthService instance. It forwards calls for user authentication, token management, and validation.

This service handles user and subscriber authentication, authorization, and session token generation within the Novu platform, supporting various authentication methods including social logins and API keys.
This file defines a Passport strategy for authenticating subscribers using JWTs, specifically validating them as 'widget_user' and constructing a subscriber session.
This file defines a Passport.js strategy for API key authentication, including caching, feature flag integration, and an organization-level kill switch to manage service availability.

This file defines the GitHub authentication strategy for the application, using Passport.js to handle OAuth 2.0 flow for GitHub users. It integrates with the application's authentication service to validate and authenticate users based on their GitHub profiles.

This file defines a Passport JWT strategy for authenticating users based on a JSON Web Token, validating user sessions and resolving the associated environment ID for authorization within the application.
This file defines a NestJS guard that authenticates internal callback requests by validating an API key provided in the Authorization header against an environment variable.

This file provides utility functions to validate HMAC (Hash-based Message Authentication Code) signatures for subscriber IDs and context payloads, ensuring the integrity and authenticity of data using a secret key.

This file defines a custom NestJS parameter decorator for extracting and decoding subscriber session information. It retrieves user data from the request, typically by decoding a JWT from the 'Authorization' header.
This file contains utility functions related to authentication, specifically for checking if an authorization header signifies a keyless token.

This file defines a NestJS guard that validates incoming requests by comparing an HMAC signature provided in the request headers with a calculated signature based on the request body and a secret key, preventing unauthorized access.
This file defines a NestJS controller specifically for testing various authentication and authorization scenarios within the application, marked to be excluded from API documentation.
This file defines the RateLimitingModule, which configures and provides rate-limiting functionalities for the API, including the ThrottlerModule and related use cases and interceptors.

This file defines custom NestJS decorators, `ThrottlerCategory` and `ThrottlerCost`, for specifying rate limiting categories and costs. It uses `Reflector` to create metadata decorators for API rate limiting.

This file defines the `CreateUserCommand` class, a data transfer object used to encapsulate all necessary information for creating a new user, including personal details and authentication credentials. It specifies properties like email, name, picture, and details about the authentication provider.

This NestJS module configures and provides core shared services such as data access (DAL), analytics, authentication (JWT), and real-time communication (WebSockets, Queues) for the Novu application's WebSocket service.

This file defines custom NestJS parameter decorators, `UserSession` and `SubscriberSession`, to extract user or subscriber session information from incoming HTTP or GraphQL requests. It decodes JWT bearer tokens from the authorization header or retrieves an already authenticated user object.

This file defines the `AuthDto` data transfer object, including its TypeScript type, Zod schemas for validation (inbound/outbound), and utility functions for JSON serialization/deserialization. It appears to be a generated file for handling authentication data.

This file defines a `UserSession` class used in testing to set up and manage an authenticated user's session, including organization, environment, and subscriber data, for both community and enterprise editions of the Novu application.
This file provides a mock implementation of the Clerk backend client for testing purposes. It simulates Clerk API calls for user and organization management using in-memory data structures.

This file defines a custom TypeScript type, `ClerkJwtPayload`, which extends the standard Clerk JWT payload with additional user-specific properties. It is likely used within the testing utilities for the enterprise edition of the application to represent extended user information in JWTs.
This file provides mock data for Clerk users, organizations, and organization memberships. It is used for testing purposes, simulating Clerk backend entities.
Defines the 'AuthMechanism' type, which specifies various supported authentication mechanisms for the application's data access layer.

This directory is part of the Novu enterprise packages and is dedicated to handling authentication concerns. It likely encapsulates all authentication-related logic, services, and potentially third-party integrations required for secure user access within the enterprise version of the platform.
This file sets up a Hono web application that manages WebSocket connections, including authentication and internal message handling. It serves as the entry point for a WebSocket-based service.

This file provides middleware for authenticating internal API requests using an API key from the Authorization header. It securely validates the provided key against a configured internal API key using a constant-time comparison to prevent timing attacks.

This file provides utility functions for JWT token verification and decoding. It also exports a Hono middleware to authenticate requests by verifying a JWT provided in a query parameter and extracting user information into the request context.
This file provides an authentication middleware for Hono applications, validating requests using a Bearer token against a configured API key.
This file defines Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) for creating and representing an organization, including fields like name, logo, and job title.
Aggregates and re-exports various Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) related to organization management, including creation, updates, and member invitation functionalities.
This file defines the Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) for bulk inviting members to an organization. It includes interfaces for the request payload and the response for a bulk invitation operation.
Defines the data transfer object (DTO) for the response when retrieving an organization invitation, including details about the inviter, organization, and invitee.
Defines a constant key used for identifying or managing an 'invite team member' nudge feature. This constant is shared across different parts of the application.

This file defines a service for managing organizations, specifically handling their creation and synchronization between Clerk (an authentication service) and Novu's internal organization system, as well as their deletion from Clerk.
This file defines API client functions and data transfer objects (DTOs) for managing organization settings and external organization metadata within the application.
This file defines a React component that renders a confirmation modal, prompting the user to create a new organization in a specific region when no existing organization is found there.

This file provides the user interface and logic for creating a new organization within the application, integrating with Clerk for organization management and allowing users to select a region. It includes form components, an illustration, and telemetry tracking for organization creation.

This file defines the `OrganizationSettings` component, which provides a UI for managing an organization's settings, including Novu branding and integration with different authentication providers like Clerk.
This file re-exports the `OrganizationDropdown` component from a Clerk-specific implementation. It serves as an alias or a public interface for the component, abstracting its underlying source.

This React component provides a dropdown menu for users to view their current organization, switch between other available organizations, and create new ones within the Novu dashboard, with optional region-based filtering.
This file defines a React component for displaying and managing a user's organizations, including listing existing organizations, creating new ones, and switching the active organization.
This React component provides a user interface for viewing and updating an organization's name and slug. It includes features for editing, saving changes, and handling permissions and loading states.

This file contains a React component (`TeamMembers`) for managing an organization's team members. It allows users to view current members and pending invitations, invite new members, and remove existing ones, with appropriate role-based access controls.

This file defines a React component for an organization dropdown menu. It allows users to view the current organization, switch between organizations they are a member of, and create new organizations, using Clerk for authentication and organization management.

This component handles the process of accepting an organization invitation by extracting the invitation ID from URL parameters, authenticating the user, making an API call to accept the invitation, and then redirecting the user or displaying error messages.

This file contains React components for managing user organizations, allowing users to create a new organization or select an existing one within the authentication flow. It handles UI display, form submission, and API interactions for organization creation and selection.

This file defines a React Context Provider and a custom hook for managing and providing the current organization's data within a self-hosted Novu dashboard application, including fetching organization details with JWT validation.
This file defines the OrganizationListPage component, which allows users to select or create an organization. It includes a redirection logic for self-hosted, non-enterprise deployments.

This file defines the `InvitationAcceptPage` component, which handles the user interface for accepting an invitation. It conditionally redirects users if the authentication provider is 'clerk' or renders the invitation acceptance form and an authentication side banner for other providers.
This file defines the main settings page for the Novu dashboard, providing a tabbed interface for managing user account, organization details, team members, and billing information.

This file defines the VercelIntegrationPage component, which allows users to link their Vercel projects with Novu organizations and environments. It handles fetching Vercel integration details, projects, and user organizations, and presents a form for configuring the integration.

This file defines a React hook (`useFetchOrganizationSettings`) that fetches and manages organization settings using `@tanstack/react-query`, conditionally enabled based on the current environment and self-hosting status.

This file defines a custom React hook `useUpdateOrganizationSettings` that handles updating organization settings using `react-query` mutations, including optimistic updates, cache invalidation, and error handling.
This file acts as an index for the 'switch organization' feature within the authentication use cases, exporting its command and use case implementations.

This file defines the InvitesModule, a NestJS module responsible for handling invitation-related functionalities. It configures controllers and providers (use cases) for managing invites within the application.

This file defines the API endpoints for managing user invitations within an organization. It provides functionalities for inviting single or multiple members, accepting invites, retrieving invite details, and resending invitations.
This file serves as an index for all invite-related use cases within the application's API, consolidating them into a single exportable array.
This file defines the `AcceptInviteCommand`, a command object used for accepting an invitation within the application. It extends `AuthenticatedCommand` and requires an invitation token.

This file defines the `AcceptInvite` use case, which handles the logic for a user accepting an invitation to join an organization. It validates the invite, updates the member status, and notifies the inviter.
Defines the command structure for retrieving an invitation using a provided token. This command is part of the 'get invite' use case within the API application.

This file defines a use case for retrieving and validating details about an invitation using an invite token. It fetches information about the invited member, the inviting organization, and the inviter.
This file defines the `ResendInviteCommand`, representing the data structure required to resend an invitation to a specific member within an organization.

This file defines a NestJS use case responsible for resending an invitation to an existing invited member of an organization, sending a new invitation email via the Novu API, and updating the invitation details in the database.
Defines the command for bulk inviting users to an organization, specifying the email and optional role for each invitee.

This file defines the `BulkInvite` use case, which orchestrates the process of inviting multiple members to an organization by iterating through a list of invitees and utilizing the `InviteMember` use case for each invitation.
This file defines the `InviteMemberCommand`, which is a data transfer object used to encapsulate the necessary information (email and role) for inviting a new member to an organization.

This file defines a use case for inviting a new member to an organization. It handles sending an invitation email, generating a unique token, and recording the new member's invited status and details in the database.
This file contains end-to-end tests for the GET /v1/invites/:inviteToken API endpoint. It verifies the retrieval of a valid invite object and handles cases with expired invite tokens.
This file contains end-to-end tests for the `/invites/resend` API endpoint, verifying both successful invite resending and error handling for invalid scenarios.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the invite acceptance API endpoint (`/invites/:inviteToken/accept`). It verifies successful invitation acceptance flows, including how existing users are handled, and tests scenarios involving invalid or expired invite tokens.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the bulk invitation feature in the Novu API. It verifies the `/v1/invites/bulk` POST endpoint's behavior for various scenarios, including successful invitations, validation errors, and handling of already invited users.
This file defines Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) for handling bulk member invitation requests, including validation rules for individual invitee emails and the overall list of invitees.
This file defines Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) for the Novu API, specifically for validating input when inviting new members and handling invite-related webhooks.
Defines the data transfer object (DTO) for the resend invite functionality, specifying the required 'memberId' for the API request.

This file defines the abstract base class `OrganizationCommand`, which extends `AuthenticatedCommand` and includes an `organizationId`. It serves as a foundation for commands that require both authentication and an associated organization context.

This NestJS module defines the organization-related functionalities, including controllers, providers (use cases), and middleware. It dynamically loads enterprise features and switches between controllers based on authentication and enterprise enablement flags.

This file defines the NestJS controller for managing organizations and their members. It exposes API endpoints for operations such as creating, retrieving, renaming organizations, updating branding details, and managing organization members.

This file defines an API controller for managing organization-related operations, including retrieving organization details, updating branding, renaming, and managing organization settings. It appears to be part of an Enterprise Edition (EE) or extended feature set due to its naming.
Defines the data transfer object (DTO) for retrieving a list of organization entities, which is an array of `OrganizationEntity`.
This file defines the `IGetMyOrganizationDto` interface, which represents the data transfer object for retrieving an organization's details, essentially mirroring the `OrganizationEntity` structure.
This file defines the data transfer object (DTO) for retrieving organization settings. It specifies properties like branding removal, default locale, and target locales, along with validation rules.

This file defines Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) for representing member-related information within an organization, including user details, invitation data, and the overall member response structure. It specifies the properties and validation rules for member data when it's returned by the API.
Defines the data transfer object (DTO) for renaming an organization, requiring a string 'name' property.
This file defines the Data Transfer Object (DTO) for updating an organization's settings, including options for Novu branding, default locale, and target locales.

This file defines Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) for API responses related to an organization, including its branding details and partner configurations. It specifies the structure and validation rules for the data returned from organization-related API endpoints.

This file defines the `CreateOrganizationDto` Data Transfer Object, used to encapsulate and validate the data required when creating a new organization within the Novu API. It specifies properties such as name, logo, job title, domain, and language, along with their respective validation rules.
Defines the data transfer object (DTO) for updating the role of a member within an organization, specifically specifying the allowed member role.
Defines the Data Transfer Object (DTO) for updating an organization's branding details, including validation rules for properties like logo URL, colors, and font family.
This file contains end-to-end tests for the API endpoint responsible for changing a member's role within an organization. It tests updating roles between admin and regular members.
This file contains an end-to-end test for retrieving the current user's organization profile via the '/organizations/me' API endpoint.
