This file defines the `UserProfile` React component, which renders a user button from Clerk. It conditionally displays an option to revert to a legacy dashboard version based on feature flags and organization creation date.

This file defines the structure for a 'Usecase' and provides a utility function `getChannelOptions` that returns a predefined list of communication channel use cases (e.g., In-App, Email, SMS) with their associated display properties.

This file implements a React component for a questionnaire form that collects user and organization details like job title, organization type, and company size to personalize the user's experience and update their profile metadata during onboarding.

This component (`MobileMessage`) displays a message to mobile users indicating that desktop setup is required for Novu integration and automatically triggers an email containing setup instructions (once per hour) if accessed from a mobile device.

This React component, `UsecaseSelectOnboarding`, provides an interactive interface for users to select their intended Novu use cases or notification channels during an onboarding process. It displays a list of channel options as clickable cards, allowing users to choose how they plan to utilize the platform.
This React component provides a UI for picking an avatar, allowing users to input a custom URL or select from a list of predefined avatars using a popover interface.

This component renders a 'Getting started' menu item in the dashboard's side navigation, displaying user onboarding progress. It allows users to track their completion of onboarding steps and provides an option to hide the menu item once all steps are finished.

This file defines the `ProgressSection` component, which displays a user's onboarding or welcome progress in the Novu dashboard. It renders a list of interactive steps, showing their completion status and linking to relevant setup pages, with variations for new and existing home page layouts.
This React component provides UI and logic for users to manage their profile information, including updating their name, email address, and changing their password, within a dashboard application.
This file defines the `QuestionnairePage` component, which renders a setup questionnaire form for desktop and a mobile message for smaller screens, likely for initial workspace setup or onboarding.

This file defines the `UsecaseSelectPage` component, which allows users to select their application's use cases (e.g., notification channel types) during onboarding, updating this information in their organization's metadata and guiding subsequent navigation.

This file defines the 'WelcomePage' component, which serves as an onboarding page for new users. It displays user progress and provides animated lists of helpful resources and learning materials, while also tracking page views via telemetry.

This file defines a React hook `useOnboardingSteps` that calculates and returns the current status of a user's onboarding steps for the Novu platform. It dynamically generates steps based on user actions, organization metadata, and self-hosted status.

This directory is designated to store public illustrations intended for the welcome section of the dashboard application. It serves as a dedicated location for visual assets that greet users or introduce features.

This file defines a use case for generating a pre-signed URL for uploading files. It determines the appropriate storage path based on the upload type (e.g., user profile, branding) and then requests a signed URL from the underlying storage service.
This file defines a NestJS controller for internal support-related functionalities, including creating support threads, fetching customer details, and triggering mobile setup notifications.
This file defines a use case for fetching customer details, including their organizations and sessions. It then formats this information into UI components (cards) for display using the Plain SDK.

This file defines the NestJS User Module, encapsulating user-related controllers and business logic (use cases) for the API. It organizes user functionalities and makes them available for other parts of the application.
This file defines the API controller for user-related operations, handling requests to retrieve user profiles and update various user attributes like email, onboarding status, and personal details.
This file defines the Data Transfer Object (DTO) for requesting the status of a user's onboarding tour, primarily indicating whether it should be shown.

This file defines the `ChangeProfileEmailDto` Data Transfer Object, used for validating the email when a user requests to change their profile email. It ensures the provided email is defined and in a valid format.
This file defines the data transfer objects (DTOs) for user responses in the API, specifying the structure of user data returned to clients, including optional fields and nested service hashes.

This file defines the `UserOnboardingRequestDto`, a Data Transfer Object (DTO) used for requests related to a user's onboarding status. It contains a single boolean property, `showOnBoarding`, to indicate whether onboarding should be displayed.

This file defines the Data Transfer Object (DTO) for updating a user's profile, specifying the fields and validation rules for the incoming request body. It includes properties for first name, last name, and an optional profile picture URL.
This file contains end-to-end tests for the user profile email change functionality, covering scenarios like providing an existing email, successful updates, and email normalization.
This file contains an end-to-end test suite for the 'get my user profile' API endpoint, verifying that the authenticated user's profile data is correctly returned.
This file contains end-to-end tests for updating a user's name and profile picture via the `/users/profile` API endpoint, including tests for successful updates and invalid input handling.

This file defines a base class for user profile use cases, primarily responsible for mapping a `UserEntity` to a `UserResponseDto` by transforming the user's password status into a boolean `hasPassword` field.
This file aggregates and exports an array of all user-related use cases, such as creating a user, retrieving profile information, and updating various user properties.
This file defines a use case responsible for updating a user's first name, last name, and optionally their profile picture, and then invalidating the user's cache.
Defines the command structure for updating a user's first name, last name, and optionally their profile picture. It includes validation rules for the input fields.
This file serves as an index for the 'create-user' use case, re-exporting its command and use case implementations.

This file defines the `CreateUser` use case, responsible for creating a new user entity in the database. It constructs a user object from a command, populating its fields and persisting it via the `UserRepository`.

This file defines the `UpdateOnBoardingCommand`, used to update a user's onboarding preferences, specifically whether the onboarding flow should be shown. It extends `AuthenticatedCommand` and includes an optional boolean property for `showOnBoarding`.
This file defines the use case for updating a user's onboarding status. It updates the `showOnBoarding` flag in the database and invalidates the user cache.
This file defines a NestJS use case responsible for updating a user's onboarding tour status in the database and invalidating the corresponding cache entry.

This file defines the `UpdateOnBoardingTourCommand`, a command used within the API to update an authenticated user's on-boarding tour status. It includes an optional numeric property, `showOnBoardingTour`, for this update.

This file defines the `UpdateProfileEmailCommand` class, which specifies the data structure and validation rules for updating a user's profile email within an authenticated context. It includes properties for the new email address and the environment ID.
This file defines the `UpdateProfileEmail` use case responsible for updating a user's email address, including validation, persistence, cache invalidation, and analytics tracking.

This file defines the `GetMyProfileUsecase`, which encapsulates the business logic for retrieving a user's profile information. It fetches the profile from the database and includes temporary logic for Intercom identity verification hash generation.
This file defines the `GetMyProfileCommand`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to initiate a request for an authenticated user's own profile information.
This file defines the UserService, an Injectable NestJS service responsible for handling business logic related to user entities, specifically providing a method to retrieve user data.
This file defines the `EEUserService` for managing user entities within an Enterprise Edition (EE) context, providing methods to create and retrieve users, likely for testing purposes.

This file defines the IdentityProvider component, which manages the identification of the current user, organization, and selected region across various third-party services like Sentry, Segment, and LaunchDarkly for analytics and feature flagging purposes.
This file serves as an entry point for self-hosted region-specific functionalities, exporting providers, hooks, modals, selectors, types, utilities, and configuration related to region management.

Defines TypeScript types and interfaces related to geographical regions, organization metadata (including region information), and a context for managing and interacting with selected regions within the application.

This file serves as a central export point for all region-related functionalities and components within the dashboard application, including context, modals, selectors, types, utilities, and configuration, specifically tailored for a cloud version with Clerk integration.

This file defines the `RegionSelector` React component, which allows users to select a geographical region within the Novu dashboard. Its visibility and functionality are controlled by LaunchDarkly feature flags and other contextual conditions.

This file defines a React context and provider for managing regional settings in a self-hosted environment, setting API and WebSocket hostnames based on a default region while explicitly disabling region switching.

This file defines a React context (`RegionContext`) and provider (`RegionProvider`) responsible for managing the application's current operational region. It handles region detection, switching between regions and organizations, configuring API hostnames, and managing related UI flows like organization creation.

This file defines a React component for a region picker that allows users to select their data residency (US or EU) and redirects them to the corresponding dashboard URL. It also provides information about data residency via a tooltip.

This file contains an end-to-end test for the API endpoint that generates a pre-signed S3 URL for file uploads, verifying that the URL is correctly formatted and includes the specified extension and organization/environment identifiers.

This script is an administrative tool designed to remove a user account from the system. It locates a user by email, removes them from any associated organizations, and then deletes their user record, making JSON backups during the process.

This script is designed to remove an organization and all its associated data (e.g., members, environments, notifications, subscribers, etc.) from the database. It takes an organization ID as input, backs up the data to JSON files, and then proceeds with the deletion of all related entities.

This script is a database migration for a Novu application, iterating through organizations to ensure environments are properly linked/created and applying 'changes' for notification groups, message templates, and notification templates that lack a parent entity.
This file contains unit tests for the `encryptApiKeysMigration` function, ensuring that it correctly encrypts old API keys and that the migration process is idempotent.

This file contains a migration script that iterates through environments, encrypts unencrypted API keys using a specific format and hashing, and updates them in the database. It includes helper functions for the encryption logic and checking if a key is already encrypted.

This file is a migration script designed to normalize user email addresses in the database. It iterates through all users, applies an email normalization function, and updates the database records while logging statistics on normalized emails and potential duplicates.

Billing & Subscription Management.description: Provides enterprise-grade billing functionalities, including subscription management, usage tracking against service-level quotas, and integration with payment providers for handling various pricing tiers.

files.description: This file serves as an entry point to export all Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) related to subscriptions, specifically re-exporting the `get-subscription.dto`.

Defines the data transfer object (DTO) for retrieving detailed information about a user's subscription, encompassing its status, billing periods, event consumption, trial specifics, and cancellation date.
This file defines API functions related to billing and subscription management for the dashboard application, specifically for fetching subscription details.
Defines the data transfer object (DTO) used for retrieving and structuring detailed subscription information in API responses.
This file defines the `UpdateSubscriptionRequestDto`, a Data Transfer Object used for updating existing subscription details, including the subscription's name and its associated preferences.
This file defines the Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) for the response when creating multiple subscriptions, including details for successful subscriptions, errors, and overall metadata.

This file defines Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) for plain representations of customers, tenants, threads, and a request object for card-related data within the API. It is used to structure data for API requests or responses.
Defines the Data Transfer Object (DTO) for the response of a usage logging operation. It indicates whether the logging operation was successful.

This file defines the `SubscriptionsModule` for a NestJS application, responsible for organizing and providing subscription-related functionalities and use cases. It integrates shared modules and makes specific use cases available for other parts of the application.
This file serves as an index (barrel) for the subscription-related use cases, aggregating and exporting them for easier access and dependency injection within the application.
This file serves as an index for the 'update subscription' use case, re-exporting its command and use case components for easier access.

This file defines the `UpdateSubscriptionCommand` class, which serves as a data transfer object (DTO) encapsulating the necessary data and validation rules for updating a subscription in the application's API.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the `CreateSubscription` use case within the Novu enterprise billing module. It verifies subscription creation logic for monthly and annual billing intervals, including trial configurations and error handling.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the `VerifyCustomer` use case in the billing module. It verifies scenarios such as customer existence, deletion status, and proper retrieval of customer and organization data, including error handling.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the 'GetPlatformNotificationUsage' use case, which verifies the accurate retrieval of notification usage data for billing purposes across different organizations and date ranges.

This file contains an end-to-end test for the billing portal link generation functionality, specifically for the enterprise edition of Novu. It tests the `GetPortalLink` use case, verifying that it correctly interacts with billing services and retrieves the portal URL.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the `GetSubscription` use case in the Novu enterprise edition billing module. It verifies the correct retrieval of subscription details, usage fetching, and error handling for missing licensed or metered subscriptions from Stripe data.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the `GetPrices` use case in Novu's billing module, specifically for enterprise edition features. It verifies that the application correctly retrieves Stripe prices for different API service levels and billing intervals by mocking the Stripe API.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the `customer.subscription.created` Stripe webhook event handler. It verifies how the system processes new customer subscriptions, updates organization service levels, and invalidates caches based on various subscription details and scenarios.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Stripe `customer.subscription.deleted` webhook event handler. It verifies how the Novu billing system processes subscription cancellations, including managing linked subscriptions and updating the organization's API service level.

This is an end-to-end test file for the `CreateUsageRecords` use case within the Novu platform's enterprise billing module. It verifies the proper creation and management of Stripe usage records based on platform notification usage, handling various subscription and customer scenarios.

This file defines the `CreateSubscriptionsResponseDto` type, which represents the response structure for a subscription creation operation. It includes data for successful subscriptions, errors for failed attempts, and metadata, along with a Zod schema and a JSON parsing utility.

This file defines the `SubscriptionsDeleteErrorDto` type, representing an error structure for subscription deletion, including subscriber ID, error code, and message. It also provides a Zod schema and a utility function to parse this DTO from a JSON string.
This file defines the data transfer object (DTO) for subscription details, including its structure, a Zod schema for validation, and a function to deserialize it from JSON.

Defines the `SubscriptionErrorDto` data transfer object, its Zod schema for validation, and a function to parse it from JSON. This DTO represents error details for a subscription failure within an internal SDK.

This file defines the `SubscriptionResponseDto` and `Subscriber` data transfer objects (DTOs) along with their Zod schemas for validation and functions for JSON deserialization. It is a generated file likely used within an SDK to represent subscription-related data from an API.

This directory is designated to contain the source code for the billing package within the enterprise suite of the Novu platform. It is responsible for managing all billing-related functionalities, including subscription management, invoicing, and payment processing for enterprise users.
Defines an enumeration for various product features, likely used for billing or feature flagging within the application.
This file defines types and enums related to an organization's structure and metadata, including service levels, billing intervals, product use cases, and public metadata fields.

This file defines an enumeration of various features (e.g., platform, inbox, account administration) and maps them to different service tiers (Free, Pro, Business, Enterprise, Unlimited) with specific values, limits, or boolean flags. It serves to manage feature availability and pricing across different subscription plans for the Novu service.

This file defines a mapping that indicates which product features are enabled for each API service level. It dynamically populates this mapping by checking feature-tier constants for each service level.

This file defines the configuration for billing features across different service levels (plans) in the Novu dashboard. It categorizes features into sections and specifies which features are included or excluded for each plan, providing utilities to retrieve and display this information.
This NestJS interceptor checks if a requested product feature is enabled for the user's organization based on its service level, blocking access with a 'Payment Required' error if it's not.
This file contains end-to-end tests for a product feature API endpoint. It verifies the API's behavior, specifically checking responses based on the organization's API service level.
This file defines an enumeration (`ResourceEnum`) for different types of resources that are subject to limiting, such as events.

This file defines types, enums, and interfaces for configuring API rate limiting, including algorithms, costs, maximums per service level and category, and the format of corresponding environment variables.
This file defines constants for API rate limiting, including mappings between rate limit categories and feature names, and default configurations for rate limit algorithms and costs.
This file serves as an index for API rate-limiting constants, re-exporting all definitions from './apiRateLimits' to provide a unified export point.

This file defines NestJS controllers with various endpoints configured to test different combinations of API rate-limiting categories and costs. It's used to verify the application's rate-limiting functionality.

This file serves as an entry point for exporting rate-limiting guards and decorators, making them easily accessible for use within the application's API. It consolidates exports from `throttler.decorator.ts` and `throttler.guard.ts`.

This file implements a NestJS interceptor for API rate limiting, dynamically evaluating limits based on user context, feature flags, and API categories/costs, while also setting RFC-compliant RateLimit HTTP headers.
This file serves as an index for rate-limiting use cases, exporting a collection of classes responsible for evaluating, configuring, and determining maximum API rate limits.

This file defines the `EvaluateApiRateLimitResponseDto` TypeScript type, which specifies the structure for responses returned when evaluating an API rate limit. It includes details such as success status, limits, remaining requests, and reset times.
This file serves as a barrel export for the 'evaluate API rate limit' use case, consolidating its command, types, and core use case implementation into a single, easily importable module.

This file contains unit tests for the `EvaluateApiRateLimit` use case, ensuring it correctly calculates and evaluates API rate limits based on various configurations and algorithms like token bucket. It verifies the returned rate limit properties such as success status, remaining tokens, limits, costs, and burst limits.

This file defines the `EvaluateApiRateLimitCommand` class, which serves as a data transfer object (DTO) for parameters required to evaluate an API rate limit, including category, cost, and optional contextual identifiers.

This file defines the `EvaluateApiRateLimit` use case, which orchestrates the evaluation of API rate limits for incoming requests using a token bucket algorithm. It determines rate limits based on organization/environment, applies configurable costs, and calculates token bucket parameters like burst limits and refill rates.

This file contains unit tests for the `GetApiRateLimitCostConfig` use case, verifying its ability to load default API rate limit cost configurations and correctly apply overrides from environment variables.
This file serves as an entry point, re-exporting the `get-api-rate-limit-cost-config.usecase` for easier access and module organization within the application's API rate-limiting feature.
This file defines a NestJS service responsible for loading API rate limit cost configurations. It initializes with default values and allows overriding specific costs via environment variables.
This file defines types for API rate limit maximum and service levels, specifically `GetApiRateLimitMaximumDto` for efficient caching of rate limit data.
This file serves as a barrel file, re-exporting the command and use case related to fetching the API rate limit maximum. It acts as a central entry point for these rate-limiting components.
This file contains unit tests for the `GetApiRateLimitMaximum` use case, verifying its logic for determining API rate limits based on environment, organization service levels, and default settings.

This file defines a NestJS use case (`GetApiRateLimitMaximum`) responsible for determining the maximum API rate limit for a given API category, environment, and organization, considering environment-specific overrides and organization service tiers.
This file defines the `GetApiRateLimitMaximumCommand` class, which is a command object used to request the maximum API rate limit for a specified category within a particular environment.

This file defines the `EvaluateTokenBucketRateLimitCommand` class, which serves as a data transfer object specifying the parameters required to evaluate a token bucket rate limit, including its identifier, token capacity, window duration, cost, and refill rate.

This file serves as an index for the 'evaluate token bucket rate limit' feature, re-exporting its command, types, and use case. It centralizes the exports for this specific rate-limiting evaluation logic.

This file defines types and interfaces for implementing and evaluating token bucket rate limiting, including the response data transfer object (DTO) and configurations for a cost-based limiter using the Upstash Ratelimit library.

This file contains unit tests and integration tests for the `EvaluateTokenBucketRateLimit` use case, including tests for cache service interaction, error handling, and a skipped section with benchmarks for the Redis EVAL script used in token bucket rate limiting.

This file defines a NestJS use case for evaluating a custom token bucket rate-limiting algorithm. It uses Redis (via an adapted cache service) and a Lua script to manage token consumption, refills, and calculate rate limit status, supporting variable costs per request.
This file contains end-to-end tests for the API rate limiting feature, verifying its behavior, header values, policy enforcement, and decorator functionality under various conditions.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the quota throttler guard, verifying resource limiting behavior under different self-hosted configurations and API service levels. It simulates various quota usage scenarios to ensure correct blocking or allowing of requests.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the `GetEventResourceUsage` use case. It verifies how event resource limits are calculated based on subscription data, including scenarios where limits are reached, the evaluation times out, or subscription data for included events is missing.

This file defines a React component `UpgradeCTATooltip` that displays a tooltip for premium features, prompting users to upgrade their plan, with varying redirection logic based on whether the application is self-hosted or cloud-based.

This file defines a React component named `PlanSwitcher` that allows users to select between monthly and annual billing intervals for a plan, often used in a billing or plan comparison section of a dashboard.
This React component renders a dynamic action button for billing plans, enabling users to manage their current subscription, upgrade, or downgrade based on their current plan and trial status.

This file defines React components and logic for displaying a comparison of features across different billing plans (e.g., Free, Pro, Business, Enterprise). It fetches and formats feature details for each plan, indicating availability or specific values.

This file defines a React component for a 'Contact sales' button that integrates with Cal.com to allow users to schedule a meeting. It also tracks telemetry when clicked, indicating an interest in enterprise-level services.

This component (`Plan.tsx`) displays the user's current billing plan, allows them to switch between monthly and annual billing intervals, and presents available subscription tiers (Free, Pro, Business, Enterprise) with their features and pricing. It also handles tracking billing-related user interactions and checkout results.

This file implements a React component (`ActivePlanBanner`) responsible for displaying the user's current billing plan, usage metrics (like workflow runs, workflows, and teammates), plan features, and actions related to their subscription. It visualizes usage data, plan details, and allows for plan management within a dashboard setting.

This file defines the `PlansRow` React component, which displays a row of interactive billing plan cards. It showcases different subscription plans with their features, pricing, and action buttons, dynamically adjusting their layout based on scroll position.
This file defines constants for HubSpot form IDs used within the billing section of the dashboard application.
This file defines an enum `ActionType` which specifies constant values for different action types, such as 'button' and 'contact', likely used within the billing section of the dashboard application.

This file defines the CustomerSupportButton component, which renders a 'Help' button in the application header. Its behavior dynamically changes based on deployment type (self-hosted vs. hosted) and feature flags, either opening a support drawer, initiating a live chat, or directing to an upgrade page.

This file defines a React component named `LockUpgrade` that renders an SVG icon depicting a lock with an upgrade or star symbol. It is likely used in a UI to represent a locked feature that can be upgraded.

This component renders a switch that allows users to control the visibility of Novu branding. It integrates with subscription data to restrict this feature to paid plans or specific permissions, prompting upgrades for free users.

This file defines the `FreeTrialCard` React component, which displays a user's free trial status in a side navigation. It shows the remaining days, a progress bar, and includes a link to upgrade, along with a tooltip explaining post-trial free tier benefits.

This file defines a React component that displays a user's subscription usage, including current events, limits, a progress bar, and a reset date, with an option to upgrade. It also tracks telemetry for user interactions.
This React component displays a paywall state for the webhooks feature, informing users that they need to upgrade their plan to create webhooks and providing an upgrade option.

This file defines a React component that displays the 'Powered by Novu' branding. It allows users on eligible subscription plans to remove this branding via organization settings, otherwise, it prompts them to upgrade their plan.

This file defines a React hook (`useBillingPortal`) that handles navigating users to a billing portal. It performs an API call to retrieve the portal URL, tracks telemetry events, and redirects the user upon success or shows an error toast on failure.

This file defines a React hook `useFetchSubscription` that fetches a user's billing subscription details. It calculates the remaining days in the trial period and returns the subscription data along with its loading status.

This file defines a React component for an email template that notifies users about their monthly event usage limits and encourages them to upgrade their plan. It also includes a function to render this email asynchronously.

Activity Feed & Analytics.description: Delivers detailed analytics and a real-time activity feed to monitor notification performance. Provides insights into delivery rates, user engagement, and workflow execution across all channels.

files.description: This file defines a constant for a UTM campaign query parameter, likely used for tracking marketing-related links or in-app promotions.
This file defines a service for integrating and managing analytics tracking using Segment. It provides methods to identify users, track specific events, and handle the analytics client's lifecycle.
This file contains functions for sending telemetry data, including measuring specific events and identifying users within the application.

This file defines the `useSegment` React hook, which provides convenient access to the `SegmentContext` within the application. It ensures the context is used within its provider, throwing an error otherwise.

This file defines a reusable React hook and components for displaying an animated promotional banner with interactive feedback capabilities. It integrates with a telemetry system to track user interactions like banner views, dismissals, and reactions.

This file defines the `SegmentService` class, which integrates Segment.io and Mixpanel for analytics tracking in the application. It handles user identification, event tracking, group tracking, and session recording, synchronizing data between the two platforms.
This file provides utility functions for extracting web tracking-related information from the browser environment, including UTM parameters from the URL and the document referrer.

This file defines an enum, `TelemetryEvent`, which lists various user interactions and system events within the application. These events are used for telemetry tracking to gather insights into user behavior and application usage.
This file defines a React hook `usePageVisitTimestamp` that records and returns the client-side timestamp when a component mounts, indicating when the user visited or loaded the current page.

This file defines a React hook, `useFirstTriggerDetection`, which monitors a specific onboarding or demo workflow to detect if it has been triggered since a user's initial page visit or a given timestamp.

This file defines a `useTelemetry` React hook for tracking telemetry events within the dashboard. It integrates with a custom measurement API and Mixpanel, adding session recording properties and prepending `[DASHBOARD]` to event names.

This file provides a utility function `buildLog` responsible for constructing a structured request log object from API request details, user session data, and response data. It sanitizes payloads and includes relevant metadata for logging API interactions.
This module defines the telemetry services for the Novu application, responsible for collecting and reporting machine and user information using various repositories and shared modules.

This service collects and sends machine information telemetry to Novu Trace. It initializes a machine ID on application bootstrap and sends regular telemetry every hour, conditional on self-hosted and non-enterprise environments.

This file defines a service that collects anonymous usage statistics (telemetry data) such as counts of users, organizations, and workflows from the Novu platform. It sends this aggregated data daily to a telemetry service if the application is self-hosted and telemetry is enabled.
This utility file defines a function to send telemetry events and their properties to a Novu Trace endpoint via HTTP POST requests, including a timestamp and error logging.

This service periodically collects and records metrics (e.g., waiting, delayed, and active job counts) from various BullMQ queues. It then reports these operational metrics to a metrics service, primarily when running within a Novu managed service environment.
This file serves as an entry point for the activity feed entity, re-exporting its core interfaces.
Defines the TypeScript interface for a 'Feed' entity, specifying its data structure including unique identifiers, name, and associated environment and organization IDs.
This service handles promoting feed changes by either creating a new feed if it doesn't exist or deleting an existing one based on the provided command.

This file defines the FeedsModule, a NestJS module responsible for encapsulating the 'feeds' functionality of the application. It imports necessary modules, registers controllers, and provides/exports use cases related to feeds.

This file defines the FeedsController, a NestJS controller that handles API requests for managing feeds. It provides endpoints for creating, retrieving, and deleting feed resources within the application.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the feed creation and management API endpoints, including creating new feeds, associating feeds with workflow templates, updating workflows with feeds, and handling duplicate feed creation attempts.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the feed deletion functionality in the Novu API. It verifies various scenarios, including preventing deletion of feeds with existing messages and successfully deleting feeds when dependencies are cleared.
Defines the 'GetFeedsCommand' class, which is a command object used for retrieving feeds within the application, inheriting environment and user context.
This file defines a use case for retrieving all feed entities associated with a specific environment from the database. It uses the `FeedRepository` to perform the data retrieval.
Defines the data command object for creating a new feed, inheriting environment and user context, and requiring a feed name.
This file defines a use case for creating a new feed, including checking for existing feeds with the same identifier and recording the creation as a change in the system.
This file defines the `DeleteFeedCommand`, a command object used to encapsulate the necessary data for deleting a specific feed, identified by its `feedId`, within the application.
This file defines the `DeleteFeed` use case, responsible for deleting a specific feed from the database and recording this change within the system's change tracking mechanism.
This file defines the `CreateFeedRequestDto`, a Data Transfer Object used for validating the input when creating a new feed in the API, requiring a 'name' property.

This file defines the `FeedResponseDto` Data Transfer Object (DTO), specifying the structure of a feed object returned by the API, including properties like ID, name, identifier, and associated environment/organization IDs.

This file defines TypeScript interfaces, primarily `IActivity`, which represents an activity feed item with details like templates, subscribers, and jobs, along with `IActivityJob` for job-specific execution details.

This file defines the API endpoints for managing and retrieving activity data, including requests, workflow runs, and analytical charts, within the Novu application. It handles routing and delegates business logic to specific use cases for these operations.

This module defines the core functionalities for the application's activity features, including various analytical charts for delivery trends, user interactions, subscriber metrics, and workflow runs, as well as endpoints for retrieving request and workflow run data.

This file defines Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) for API responses related to retrieving request logs. It includes DTOs for individual request log entries (`RequestLogResponseDto`) and for the paginated list of request logs (`GetRequestsResponseDto`).

This file defines Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) for various chart data points and metric summaries, primarily used for structuring the response when retrieving activity and performance charts in an API.

This file defines the `GetChartsRequestDto` Data Transfer Object (DTO) for requesting chart data. It specifies the structure and validation rules for various filters, including date ranges, report types, workflow IDs, subscriber IDs, and more, used when querying for chart information.
This file defines Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) for representing the response of a workflow run, including detailed information about individual step executions and their statuses within a workflow.
This file defines the Data Transfer Object (DTO) for a request to retrieve activity details, primarily identifying the request by its ID.

This file defines the Data Transfer Object (DTO) for requesting a list of workflow runs, including parameters for filtering, pagination, and sorting. It specifies the structure and validation rules for the incoming request data.
This file defines shared Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) and enumerations for API responses related to workflow execution, topics, and various reporting metrics within the Novu platform.
